column17: On Monday, on-strike teachers organised sit-ins of protest outside the Educational offices in several regions. The demonstration was called by the National Autonomus Council of teaching personnel (CNAPESTE) to claim better wages.

Two militants were killed on Tuesday, in Ain Defla, by a detachment of the Peoples National Army (ANP). A detachment of the ANP, during a combing operation close to Grabiz in the town of Bathia in the Southwest of Ain Defla, killed two militants and seized ""a Kalashnikov-type machine pistol, a Simonov-type semi-automatic rifle, binoculars, a grenade and a quantity of ammunitions"".
Unknown militants attacked two civilian trucks that were providing a military barracks with food supplies in Akerrou, 70 km east of Tizi Ouzou. A man died and some other were injured in the attack.
Dozens of college students of Cheraga, Staoueli and Ain Benian gathered on Wednesday morning outside the directorate of Education in West Algiers (Cheraga) to demand improved education policies.

Two militants have been killed on Thursday during an ambush near the commune of El Adjiba (Bouira, 100-km east of Algiers) by a detachment of the Peoples National Army. The ANP also seized ""a Kalashnikov submachine gun, a Simonov semi-automatic rifle, a homemade bomb, a pair of binoculars, ammunition and two mobile phones"".

The Tunisian expatriates organised peaceful rallies and marches in a number of cities of the hosting countries to show their solidarity and condemn the attack of the Bardo Museum which killed several civilians. The demonstrations mainly took place in several French cities, as well as in Germany, in Sweden, in Japan, in Morocco, in Algeria and Egypt.
Protests over shale gas exploitation projects have resumed in Southern Algeria. Around 600 people staged a protest march in Ain Salah, demanding the termination of drilling tests in the region.

Protests over shale gas exploitation projects have resumed in Southern Algeria. In Tamanrasset, around people organised a sit-in outside the HQ of the local administration to protests against drilling tests in the region of Ain Salah.
An armed man was killed by the army units in the area of Djabahia, Bouira.

An armed combatant was killed in an ambush on Sunday by a detachment of the Peoples National Army (ANP) at Oued Larbaatache in the province of Boumerdes. The operation resulted in the recovery of a Kalashnikov submachine gun, a quantity of ammunition and two cell phones.

Four militants were killed on Thursday morning by the forces of the National Popular Army (ANP) near the town of Oued Ouakser, El Kharrouba, during a sweep operation, which also allowed recovering weapons and equipment of different types, including two Kalashnikov submachine guns, one Simonov semi-automatic rifle, one Beretta automatic pistol, two wireless radio devices, one pair of binoculars, a large quantity of ammunition, means of detonation, three mobile phones and twenty-one phone chips.
Residents of In Salah opposing shale gas exploitation protested outside the regional administration of In Salah and disrupted the circulation on the national route.

column7: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers; Students (Algeria); Teachers (Algeria)
column17: Hundreds of teachers, students and employees in the education sector took part in a protest march in Tizi Ouzou to demand the improvement of working conditions in their professional sector.

Clashes between anti riot troops and Berber activists were reported in the province of Boumerdes, 55 km in eastern Algiers, during the celebrations for the 35th anniversary of what is known as ""the Berber Spring,""

column8: Police Forces of Algeria (1999-) Municipal Guard
column17: Around 300 municipal guards gathered on Monday in Boufarik (10 km north of Blida) with the purpose of marching on Algiers, before they were stopped by security forces. The police blocked the highway leading to Algiers from Boufarik, forcing the protesters to organise an alternative sit-in Haouche Gros, in the surroundings of the town. A similar march, in which nearly 500 municipal guards were likewise stopped by the security forces in December near Boufarik.

Algerian troops killed three armed Islamists and recovered weapons and ammunition west of Algiers on Wednesday. The three were killed at around 1:00 am (0200 GMT) in an ambush close to the town of Hamman Righa, around 100 kilometres from the capital. The operation seized three automatic rifles, ammunition and several hand grenades, as well as binoculars and mobile phones.

According to ministerial sources, an armed man was killed, on Friday afternoon, in an ambush near the town of Djaafra, province of Bordj Bou Arreridj, by Algerian military forces. During the operation, a kalachnikov, a handgun and several ammunitions were seized.

Dozens of employees of the Gold Mines Exploitation National Company (Enor) in Tamanrasset (1920 km south of Algiers) took to the streets on Sunday to protest against the possibility of selling the company to foreign owners.

Algerian soldiers on Tuesday killed six armed Islamists in the Kabylie area some 140 kilometres (85 miles) east of the capital. A unit of the ANP (Algerian army) killed six gunmen in the afternoon during an operation near the locality of Akerrou. The ministry said that the militants, who belonged to the Katibat Ennour group, were ambushed by an army patrol after a tip off. They were killed following a lengthy exchange of fire.

Workers of SETRAM, the transport company in Oran, staged a sit-in outside the central station in Oran and went on a 10-day strike demanding the payment of overtime work, a better organisation within the company and the resignation of the current SETRAM director.
Local journalists took to the streets on Sunday in Bouira to demand improvements for their social and working conditions.

A gunman was killed on Sunday by units of the National Peoples Army (ANP) near the locality of Sidi Khlifa (Ain Defla) during a military operation where a kalachnikov et various ammunitions were also seized.
Two other militants have been killed and various kalachnikov machine pistols were recovered in Bouira area.

The circulation of vehicles in Annaba was blocked by protesters who voiced their discontent for the persistence of problems of housing. On the road in front of the port, dozens of young protesters set tyres on fire while others erected road blocks, thus creating problems to the circulation throughout the rest of the city. Police forces decided not to intervene.

Two militants were killed and a Kalachnikov machine pistol, a Simonov semi-automatic rifle and a quantity of munitions were recovered on Tuesday by the forces of the Popular National Army (ANP), following an ambush near the town of Amrouna, in the south of the province of Ain Defla.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: A group of gunmen has killed four ""patriot"" officers (paramilitary group funded by the state to help in the fight against terrorism) on a road between Batna and Setif in north-eastern Algeria. The group shot at a convoy the officers were travelling in, which set the car on fire, killing the officers on board. The group was reportedly composed of 10 individuals who shot at the convoy and killed three officers, while the fourth officer fled. This officer was then followed by the group and shot dead. AQIM later claimed responsibility for this attack.

Nearly 200 inhabitants of Beni MHaffer gathered outside the offices of Annaba province to demand the release of the list of the recipieients of public housing. Protests over housing cause some problems to the circulation of vehicles in Annaba in the past few days.
Protests over housing problems sprung up throughout Annaba province, involving the towns of El Bouni, Sidi Amar and Sidi Salem.
Protests over housing problems sprung up throughout Annaba province, involving the towns of El Bouni, Sidi Amar and Sidi Salem.
Protests over housing problems sprung up throughout Annaba province, involving the towns of El Bouni, Sidi Amar and Sidi Salem.
The anti-riot forces resorted to teargas to try to disperse Arab and Berber rioters in Ghardaia.

For three consecutive days, the town of Ghardaia has experienced unrest due to intercommunal clashes. Several houses, stores, and cars have been destroyed, others burned completely. The violence began in the Theniet El-Makhzen district last week and spread quickly to other places to finally settle in the El-Kaouty district. The clashes were triggered when unknown young people, arriving in large numbers, attacked the El-Kaouty district in the evening and smashed the windows of cars belonging to inhabitants as well as setting fire to several houses. These facts caused the citizens to come out to defend their property, resulting in sharp clashes between the two parties and then with the security forces that intervened and tried in vain to control the situation.

A dangerous Islamist militant was killed and a machine pistol recovered following an ambush Sunday a by a detachment of the Peoples National Army near Mount Bou Yatas, province of Sidi Bel Abbes. The operation allowed the recovery of a Kalashnikov submachine gun, a pair of binoculars and a quantity of ammunition.

For three consecutive days, the town of Ghardaia has experienced unrest due to intercommunal clashes. Several houses, stores, and cars have been destroyed, others burned completely. The violence began in the Theniet El-Makhzen district last week and spread quickly to other places to finally settle in the El-Kaouty district. The clashes were triggered when unknown young people, arriving in large numbers, attacked the El-Kaouty district in the evening and smashed the windows of cars belonging to inhabitants as well as setting fire to several houses. These facts caused the citizens to come out to defend their property, resulting in sharp clashes between the two parties and then with the security forces that intervened and tried in vain to control the situation.

Algerian military said on Tuesday it killed 22 militants in what it deemed the most important military operation in 20 years in the northern province of Bouira. Algerian security forces killed at least 22 Islamist militants Tuesday as they were meeting to plan an attack on the capital of Algiers, a security source said, adding that the rest are still under manhunt. Automatic weapons, ammunition and other weaponry were seized in the operation, said the report. A security official told Reuters news agency the militants were members of the Caliphate Soldiers, an al Qaeda splinter group that had declared allegiance to the Islamic State militant group.
The anti-riot forces resorted to teargas to try to disperse Arab and Berber rioters in Ghardaia.

For three consecutive days, the town of Ghardaia has experienced unrest due to intercommunal clashes. Several houses, stores, and cars have been destroyed, others burned completely. The violence began in the Theniet El-Makhzen district last week and spread quickly to other places to finally settle in the El-Kaouty district. The clashes were triggered when unknown young people, arriving in large numbers, attacked the El-Kaouty district in the evening and smashed the windows of cars belonging to inhabitants as well as setting fire to several houses. These facts caused the citizens to come out to defend their property, resulting in sharp clashes between the two parties and then with the security forces that intervened and tried in vain to control the situation.
The anti-riot forces resorted to teargas to try to disperse Arab and Berber rioters in Ghardaia.

Algerian forces killed three militants just east of Algiers in a counter-insurgency sweep, raising the total slain over the past two days to 25. The army continued its sweeps and killed three others who had escaped the initial attack and fled south through the rugged terrain. Algeria has been battling the local branch of al-Qaida for years but most of their operations have been restricted to attacks on security forces in the rugged central mountains. Security sources said that the leader oj Jund Al Khilafa, Bachir Kherza (also known as Abou Abdellah Al Assimi), was among the 25 militants killed by the army on 19 and 20 May in Bouira.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: An officer in the Algerian Peoples National Army has been killed after a bomb detonated in Chelala Mountains in northeastern Algeria. The mountains, located in Batna province, had been searched weeks ago after Katibat al-Mut (Death Brigade) killed four Patriot members (the civilian militias backed by the government) on 12 May. AQIM later claimed responsibility.
The residents of a neighbourhood of Oran staged a protest march to demand the authorities fulfill their responsibilities regarding land tenture regularization in their area.
People who engaged in ""National Service between 1995-1999"" protested in a Tizi Ouzou market to demand the government resolve their grievances.
1 militant was killed during an ambush by Algerian soldiersnear the town of Draa El Mizan southwest of Tizi-Ouzou.
An elected CPA was found dead and buried in Bejaia after disappearing on Jun.10.

A man who was injured in clashes in southern Algeria has died of his wounds. The 33-year-old was wounded during clashes between groups of youths that began late on Friday in Berriane, site of off-and-on confrontations between Berber and Arab communities, and later died in the hospital.

column9: Chaamba Ethnic Group (Algeria); Berber Ethnic Group (Algeria)
column17: Riot police used tear gas to disperse Arab and Berber groups who engaged in clashes in Berriane.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: Drivers and employees of the National Company of Transports went on strike on Sunday in Algiers, blocking the circulation of trains for two consecutive days.
Four people were wounded after that a molotov cocktail set their car on fire. The four people were transferred to the nearest hospital.

An unprecedented protest was organized by the camps residents in Tindouf. Protesters have staged numerous sit-ins and demonstrations to denounce the arbitrary seizure of their vehicles by the Polisario armed militia at the order of Algerian army officers. The sit-ins and protest demonstrations were staged at the initiative of the Youth Movement for Change (MJPC) in various camps of Tindouf, where hundreds of Sahrawis simultaneously took to the street.

Two armed militants have been killed on Monday evening in Azzeffoun by the forces of the Peoples National Army (ANP). The operation allowed to recover a Kalashnikov submachine gun, a Beretta automatic pistol, a quantity of ammunition and a cell phone.
Military units killed one armed militant near the town of Tacheta Zougagha. The army seized a semi-automatic rifle and ammunitions during the operation.
Military units killed other two armed militants near the town of Tacheta Zougagha. The army seized an assault rifle, a semi-automatic gun, some grenades and ammunitions during the operation.
Violent clashes erupted in Ain Bessem after that a man was accidentally shot dead by police forces. Anti-riot police intervened and restored the calm in town.
Workers of the local tramway company (SETRAM) went on strike and staged a demonstration outside the offices of the company in Algiers.
Molotov cocktails were also thrown at police units deployed in Berriane.
Intercommunal clashes continued in Berriane, between members of Arab Chaambi and Berber Mozabite ethnic groups. The two groups exchange gunfires during the night and threw molotov cocktails.
After a night of continuing ethnic clashes between Arab and Berber groups, police forces, supported by anti-riot units, resorted to teargas to disperse the youths and end violence in Berriane.
Other intercommunal clashes between Arab and Berber communities were reported in Ghardaia. Police forces, supported by anti-riot units, were deployed to restore order in town.
Workers of the local tramway companies (SETRAM) in Oran and Constantine went on strike and staged demonstrations on Sunday to demand better working conditions.
Workers of the local tramway companies (SETRAM) in Oran and Constantine went on strike and staged demonstrations on Sunday to demand better working conditions.
Three civilians were injured after a landmine exploded in Sidi Bel Abbes.

Two policemen were wounded during an attack carried out in the middle of Bouira by an unidentified armed group. The gunmen, who were in a car, fired at a police patrol near the OPOW Rabat Bitat sports complex wounding two policemen who were taken to the Mohamed Boudiaf hospital in Bouira.

Interethnic fighting erupted late on Tuesday in the town of Guerara in the Mzab valley. Three people were reported dead during clashes between Chaamba Arabs and Mozabite Berbers in Guerrara, two in Berriane and one in Ghardaia on Tuesday.

Interethnic fighting erupted late on Tuesday in the town of Guerara in the Mzab valley. Three people were reported dead during clashes between Chaamba Arabs and Mozabite Berbers in Guerrara, two in Berriane and one in Ghardaia on Tuesday.

Interethnic fighting erupted late on Tuesday in the town of Guerara in the Mzab valley. Three people were reported dead during clashes between Chaamba Arabs and Mozabite Berbers in Guerrara, two in Berriane and one in Ghardaia on Tuesday.
The citizens of Ath Vouali village blocked the administrative office of Ath Vouali in sign of protest against the disruption of local services in their village.

23 people died during ethnic clashes that erupted between youth groups in the regions of Guerrara and Mzab Valley (Ghardaia, 600 km south of Algiers) between Tuesday and Wednesday. The heaviest toll was recorded in Guerrara with 19 dead, due to projectiles thrown by unknown people. These clashes were marked by fire and acts of vandalism against houses, business premises, private vehicles and palm groves, street furniture and public buildings. An increasing number of security forces were deployed on the ground, supported by the anti-riot forces of the National Gendarmerie to put an end to these clashes which continued on Wednesday.

Dozens of people from the Mozabite community gathered Wednesday in Algiers for several hours to denounce acts of violence committed in Ghardaia and call for the return of peace and security in the region.
Members of the Mozabite community in Oran staged a demonstration in Oran to voice their protest against ethnic violence in Ghardaia region.
Sit-ins of the Mozabite communities were held in Annaba and Batna to protest again ethnic violence in Ghardaia region.
Sit-ins of the Mozabite communities were held in Annaba and Batna to protest again ethnic violence in Ghardaia region.
For the second consecutive day, members of the Mozabite community in Oran staged a demonstration in Oran to voice their protest against ethnic violence in Ghardaia region.

A gunman was killed and another arrested by the army in Msila. The operation was carried out near the town of Ain El Hadjel when a car carrying two suspicious people was controlled by elements of the National Gendarmerie. Following a shoot-out with the men in the car, the army units killed one of the gunmen and arrested the other, seizing a Kalashnikov machine gun, ammunitions, a mobile phone and other items.

A gunman was killed by the army in the locality of Ziraoua, commune of Djabahia. During the operation, a Kalashnikov sub-machine gun, a quantity of ammunition, detonation tools and a mobile phone were seized.
Dozens of people staged a march and a sit-in after the death of a young woman in the hospital of Bouira.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: At least 9 soldiers were killed in an ambush carried out by AQMI in a southern mountainous area in Ain Defla region. According to an army statement, nine soldiers were ambushed during a combing operation near the locality of Djebel Louh. AQMI claimed responsibility for the attack, saying that they killed 14 soldiers. According to Radio France Internationale, the soldiers were attacked after they recovered the bodies of other three soldiers killed on Thursday during a shoot-out in the same area.
A crowd of young people protested on Sunday outside the offices of the province against employment procedures in the train company.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Sixteen members of AQIM were killed during a military operation in Djebel Louh. The militants were suspected of having killed nine soldiers a few days before.
A militant was killed in an ambush carried out by army units near the commune of Ifigha.

Two military personnel have suffered light wounds during a shootout with a group of gunmen divided in several small groups trying to force soldiers out of the base and attract them to an ambush. The assailants used ""artisanal mortar"" then started to shower the old base with bullets in a ""carefully prepared operation"" before helicopters were dispatched to reinforce the troops.
Young people in Bechloul resumed their protest against employment procedures in the railway company. The protesters blocked the railway near Bechloul
Dozens of citizens interrupted the circulation of vehicles in Ohanet to protest against the lack of potable water in the area.
Protesters staged marches to demand justice over the disappearance of hundreds of Saharawi refugees.
An armed group attacked a station of the Gendarmerie in the east of Bouira. A clash took place between the gunmen and the soldiers.
A protest movement was launched by the security personnel of Sonatrach oil camps in Ouargla region to demand the regularisation of their professional situation.
The citizens of Kechida in Batna blocked the routes of the town to protest against the interruption of water supply that has been going on in their area for one month.
The protest movement launched by the security personnel of Sonatrach oil plants in Ouargla region extended to another Sonatrach site in Illizi.
For the second consecutive day, the security personnel of Sonatrach oil plants in Ouargla region staged a protest movement to demand the regularisation of their professional situation.

Clashes occurred in ArcelorMittal complex in El Hadjar, Annaba, involving a group of strikers and the factorys security units. According to a local source, around sixty workers tried to break into the complex but clashed with the security personnel. Eight wounded reported.

During an armed confrontation between troops of the national army and a militant group, a military officer was killed near Ain Kechra on the evening of 14 August. The soldiers were ambushed by the armed group during a combing operation in the area. During the following shootout, a militant was killed and another arrested.
Around twenty inhabitants of Ain el Turk protested outside the offices of the province to demand that some sellers in the local market are moved somewhere else.
Riots between residents of Mira village over land issues. Several wounded people reported.

Two militants were killed on Saturday in the locality of Oued Zeguere, near Ain Kechra. Military units have been carrying out operations in the area since Saturday, when a soldier was killed during a shootout with militants.
An Islamist militant was killed on Sunday in Ain Laksar, Skikda province. Other two militants were killed on Saturday.

Arrests: Algerian security forces have arrested two leading figures in Islamic State group in Tebessa Province, 20 kilometres west from the border with Tunisia. The two were reportedly Libyan nationals and were captured while trying to enter Algeria from Tunisia. The captured IS leaders were carrying two firearms and hand grenades.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Two militants linked to AQIM were killed and weapons were recovered by the special units of the Peoples National Army during an ambush in the commune of Taher. The two militants killed were Nefla Noureddine and his assistant Bouhnika Abdelouahab.
Dozens of people from Ait Said village staged a demonstration outside the provincial administration in Chabet El Ameur to protest against the lack of potable water.

A group of citizens blocked the road connecting Tizi Ouzou to Algiers in Tadmait with boulders and trees . The protesters demanded that the authorities provide explanation over the death of two young people found deadthe week before.

Arrests: Former intelligence chief, General Hassan, has been arrested at his home in Algiers and held in a military prison near Blida. He has been charged with insubordination, plot against the state, manipulation of information and detention of firearms.
Residents of Boudjima marched in protest against rising violence in the region
Abdou Chikh Talha, a militant who joined Islamist groups in 1993, was killed in moulay Slissene by army troops. During this operation, Algerian forces seized also guns and ammunitions.
Riots erupted between residents in Oued Tlelat.
In Oued Tlelat, riots between residents and newcomers continue. 19 young people, allegedly belonging to local gangs, have been arrested
Riots between local youth gangs in Barika. Police did not intervene. Several wounded people reported.

Some Polisario soldiers, belonging to the Tekna tribe, staged a protest during the an inspection visit by Polisario leader Mohamed Abdelaziz. The soldiers were protesting the rampant corruption within the Polisario military structures placed under the command of Mohamed Lamine Bouhali.

column7: UNEA: National Union of Algerian Students
column17: Students engage in protests at university in Tiaret. They blocked the entrance to denounce universities malfunctionings.
Two Islamist gunmen were killed by the Algerian army in Boumerdes province.
A sit-in was staged outside the offices of the wilaya in Boumerdes to denounce the delays in completing a housing project.
Dozens of residents set tyres on fire and erecterd roadblocks in Mostaganem to protest against the degradation of a near garbage dump site.
A movement of protest was launched by a group of teachers in Ouled Rached to protest against the state of insecurity within school structures.
Teachers in the Faculty of Law and Political Science at Akli Mohand Oulhadj University in Bouira organised a protest to denounce the current state of insecurity in the campus.
A movement of protest was launched by a group of teachers in Ouled Rached to protest against the state of insecurity within school structures.
Eleven unemployed people staged a sit-in outside the offices of the National Employment Agency in Bir El-Ater to demand jobs in the phosphate company of Djebel El Anek.
Residents of Skikda, who were assigned public housing, staged a protest in Skikda to denounce the delays in the allotment of residences.
A movement of protest was launched by a group of teachers in Ouled Rached to protest against the state of insecurity within school structures.
Eleven unemployed people staged a sit-in outside the offices of the National Employment Agency in Bir El-Ater to demand jobs in the phosphate company of Djebel El Anek.
Protesters in Sidi Bel Abbes denounced irregular employment procedures.
A movement of protest was launched by a group of teachers in Ouled Rached to protest against the state of insecurity within school structures.
Eleven unemployed people staged a sit-in outside the offices of the National Employment Agency in Bir El-Ater to demand jobs in the phosphate company of Djebel El Anek.
200 people gathered outside the police commissioners office to demand the release of the four unemployed arrested by police in the morning.

On the fourth day of protest, police arrested the eleven unemployed people who were staging a demonstration outside the offices of the National Employment Agency in Bir El-Ater to demand jobs in the phosphate company of Djebel El Anek.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM gunmen stormed the village of Bouarbi in Dellys. During a combing operation in the area, police forces exchanged fire with the assailants. No violence against civilians was reported.

A group of young residents from Mers el Kebir clashed with police forces on Friday afternoon. They started to block the routes and throw stones after that a housing project was delayed by the authorities.
Residents of Hassi Mameche staged a sit-in to draw attention on long-standing housing problems in their area.
A protest march was held on Wednesday in Amizour following the killing of two men last week.
Students protested and blocked access to Nacer Brahim high school in Bitam.
Residents of a neighbourhood in Jijel blocked the circulation of vehicles for about two hours to protest against the deterioration of transport infrastructure in the area.

column7: ONEA: National Organisation of Algerian Students
column17: Students of ONEA staged a sit-in outside a university building in Es Senia to protest against the allegedly unlawful detention of two students.

Residents of Douar Oum Teboul in Sidi MHamed Ben Ali took to the streets to voice their discontent over the degradation of living conditions in the area. They interrupted the circulation of vehicles on the road CW87, which connects their town to Taouagrit.
Residents staged a sit-in to protest against allocation of public housing.
Rioters blocked a national route in Djendel, 15km from Azzaba.

column7: RCD: Rally for Culture and Democracy Party
column17: Thousands of protesters marched in Tizi Ouzou to denounce the cancellation of investment in the region, the violation of security forces, the release of political prisoners and the recognition of Tamazight. The demonstration was called by the RCD.
Hundreds of students and teachers of the University of Bejaia marched in protest against the proposed relocation to the new campus of Amizour.
Defusal: Seven caches containing a homemade bomb and 15 antipersonnel mines have been discovered Sunday by a detachment of the National Popular Army.

The residents of a village named Leftaimate erected barricades and blocked the circulation of vehicles on the national route connecting Skikda to Annaba. The protesters denounced the poor condition of the local schooling system.
A militant was killed by the army during a combing operation conducted Monday near the place called Oued Ifrane, in Beni Rached, located between the provinces of Tipaza and Chlef.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: The army killed a militant known as Abou El-Hacen. The man, also known as Abou Hassan and Abou Salman, is described as one of the top leaders of AQIM. He was the engineer of abductions and had participated in three significant abductions in northern Mali and southern Algeria.
Several Algerian NGOs organised a sit-in in support of migrants outside the offices of Bejaia province.
300 protesters gathered outside the offices of the local administration to claim public housing. Police forces were deployed in the area.
Journalists of El Watan TV protest outside the Ministry of Communication against the closure of their channel.

Protests were registered in another town of Boumerdes province. In Bordj Menaiel, residents took to the streets to denounce the condition of the towns routes and the interruption of a project that would bring natural gas to Omar village.

Dozens of journalists and activists have been staging protests outside the parliament against the closure of private Al-Watan TV channel. This was the second day of protests against the closure of the channel following the statements given by Madani Mezrag, the leader of the Islamic Salvation Army (AIS), in which he criticized President Bouteflika.
Dozens of residents of Baghlia took to the streets to demand that asphalt on the towns routes.
Due to a protest movement initiated by residents, the mayor of Benchoud could not quit his office for several hours. The villagers had also blocked the route connecting Dellys to Baghlia.
Protests continued on Wednesday in Ben Choud.
Other protests staged by residents were reported in Berrahmoun and Aoudia, in the town of Corso.
Dozens of citizens from Cite Tenia gathered in front of the offices of the wilaya in Mila to protest against the lack of public services in their area.
In Naciria, residents blocked the traffic to protest against the failed realisation of public works in town.
A group of RND members staged a sit-in in Tamanrasset over mismanagement within their party.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Algerian soldiers killed three Islamist gunmen on Tuesday during a military operation in a region east of the capital. The army seized three Kalashnikov assault rifles as well as ammunition and nine cellphones.
Students staged a sit-in and blocked the circulation of vehicles at the entrance of the University of Skikda.

column7: Police Forces of Algeria (1999-) Municipal Guard
column17: Municipal guards organise a march and a sit-in outside the offices of the wilaya in Tiaret. Contestation concerns the allocation of public housing for officers.

Property destruction: Two detachments of the National Popular Army (ANP) discovered and destroyed Sunday in Constantine and Bordj Bouareredj five (5) blockhouses containing handcrafted guns and bombs.
Detonation: The army discovered and destroyed 16 mines and detonators near El Khroub, in Constantine province.
Residents of Constantine protested outside the local administration to claim public housing.
Residents of Medjana staged a sit-in and blocked the route to protest against the situation of roads in the area.
Weapons Seizure: A detachment under the operational sector of Bouira discovered and destroyed two caches containing explosives and food products.
Detonation: 13 mines have been discovered and destroyed Tuesday by a detachment of the National Popular Army (ANP) at the operational sector of Constantine (432 km east of Algiers).
Detonation: Explosives were destroyed Wednesday, near Djebahia, by the combined forces of the Peoples National Army (ANP).
Residents of Merouana and Ali NMer blocked the road connecting these two towns with Ouel El Ma to demand the re-opening of an alternative route, closed since the civil war.
An alleged armed militant was killed near the town of Ouled Hellal, south-west of Medea Province.

Residents of Merouana and Ali NMer blocked the road connecting these two towns with Ouel El Ma to demand the re-opening of an alternative route, closed since the civil war. Protests continue for two days.
Angry residents in Mechtet El Hassi and Mechtat Ouled H'riza, in the town of Oued El Ma, blocked the road to demand connection to the gas network.
Residents of Taxlent gathered in protest to demand a new road connection to Hidoussa.
In Hai Nasr neighbourhood, a protest movement was staged to demand the quick allocation of public housing to locals.

Residents of Remli neighbourhood, in Gue de Constantine, violently protested against recent relocations. The protesters broke the glasses of the offices of the administration. Police intervened to restore the calm without engaging in clashes with the rioters.
Students of the Spanish language department in Abdelhamid Ibn Badis University in Mostaganem staged a protest blocking access to the department.
Hundreds of people expressed their discontent and protested in Setif after the publication of the list of people being allocated public housing.
A group of young people in Skikda gathered outside the offices of the local administration denouncing their exclusion from the public housing allocation list.
Fruit sellers organised a sit-in in Chlef to denounce the urgent problems in the management of local markets.
A group of unemployed people staged a sit-in outside the site of Enafor, the National Drilling Company, to demand jobs.

Dozens of young unemployed staged a protest blocking the National Route 32 in the wilaya of Khenchela to denounce the slowness of bureaucracy. This was the second sit-in in less than one week (coded the first for November 12th, with time precision code 2).
About forty people protested outside the offices of the local administration of El Kerma over public housing.

Dozens of people gathered near the Grand Poste in Algiers to pay tribute to Razika Cherif, killed by a driver in Msila after attempted sexual harassment. Protesters denounced the silence of the authorities and of political parties and demanded a law sanctioning sexual violence.
Local residents blocked the road connecting Ain Nouissy and Ain Sidi Cherif, near Douar El Bekhaitia, and set tyres of fire to vocie their discontent over the lack of attention from the government.
Students protests and blocked access to the university buildings in El Tarf.

Dozens of young unemployed staged a protest blocking the National Route 32 in the wilaya of Khenchela to denounce the slowness of bureaucracy. This was the second sit-in in less than one week (coded the first for November 12th, with time precision code 2).

Property destruction: A cache containing six handcrafted bomb has been discovered and destroyed on Tuesday in Yakouren (Tizi Ouzou) following a search operation conducted by a detachment of the Peoples National Army.
Taxi drivers went on strike and gathered in a sit-in to protest against unfair competition.

A group of residents from Thaddarth - 45 km east of Bouira - staged a protest movement outside the local administration in Bouira to denounce the deterioration of their living conditions, the lack of public services and the lack of attention from the state.
Striking workers of the furniture industry named ""Leader Meuble de Taboukert"" decided to block the traffic in the highway close to Tizi Rached.
Algerian army killed an armed gunman in Ouled Arbi and seized a Kalashnikov machine pistol.
350 students protested outside the local administration to demand fair judgement over latest examinations.
Property destruction: Army conducted searching operations in Boumerdes and Tizi Ouzou provinces destroying shelters and mines belonging to alleged armed militants.
Property destruction: Army conducted searching operations in Boumerdes and Tizi Ouzou provinces destroying shelters and mines belonging to alleged armed militants.
Staff of the Medical Science Faculty in Oran demonstrated outside the office of the Rector in the suburbs of Es Senia. The circulation of vehicles in the neighbourhood was disrupted.
Pupils entered on strike and staged demonstrations in two vocational schools in Oran.

Three yound unemployed staged a sit-in outside the offices of the local administration in Hassi RMel, to denounce the continued marginalisation and exclusion from the authorities. The sit-in was reported to have continued for at least four days.

Three yound unemployed staged a sit-in outside the offices of the local administration in Hassi RMel, to denounce the continued marginalisation and exclusion from the authorities. The sit-in was reported to have continued for at least four days.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: Dozens of UGTA affiliates protested in Tamanrasset against the management of their organisation.

Three yound unemployed staged a sit-in outside the offices of the local administration in Hassi RMel, to denounce the continued marginalisation and exclusion from the authorities. The sit-in was reported to have continued for at least four days.

Three yound unemployed staged a sit-in outside the offices of the local administration in Hassi RMel, to denounce the continued marginalisation and exclusion from the authorities. The sit-in was reported to have continued for at least four days.

Around a hundred of students of economics and management at the University Mouloud Mammeri of Tizi Ouzou marched in protest and staged a sit-in outside the campus of Hasnaoua. They demand the respect of students rights.
Young unemployed and students protest in Djemorah against irregularities in the recruitment of workers in construction site.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Algerian soldiers killed two armed Islamists during an army sweep on Sunday in Tizi Ouzou province. The troops had so far seized two Kalashnikov assault rifles, ammunition and eight mobile phones during the operation near Aghrib, north of the town of Azzazga.

column7: PT: Workers Party; FFS: Socialist Forces Front; AAV: Green Algeria Alliance
column17: Algerian MPs from the opposition groups of the Workers Party (PT), the Socialist Forces Front (FFS) and the Green Algeria Alliance (AAV) have staged a protest inside the parliament building, in tandem with the vote on the finance bill 2016. After staging a protest inside the parliament, the opposition MPs ""stormed"" the room, interrupted work, and ""went up to the Speakers platform"", triggering a ""fist fight"" between the opposition MPs and their counterparts from the ruling coalition-led National Liberation Front (FLN).

Violent clashes erupted between protesting workers and anti-riot forces in Rouiba. The demonstrators were claiming the payment of their overdue salaries. Dozens of injuries among the protesters and over twenty arrests were reported.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Algerian soldiers killed three Islamists on Wednesday during a military operation in the region of Tizi Ouzou. Two Kalashnikov assault rifles, a pump-action shotgun and ammunition were seized during the operation north of the city of Azzazga. Five Islamists have been killed since the operation was launched on Sunday.
Workers in the Public Company for Urban and Suburban Transports of Algiers (ETUSA) protested in the capital city on Wednesday to demand the swift appointment of a general manager in the company.
A group of residents from Ichelliben protested in front of the local administration to demand the installation of a gas pipeline in their village.
SNVI workers continue their protest in Rouiba after the violent clashes with anti-riot forces that erupted the day before.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Algerian soldiers killed other two Islamists during a search operation east of the capital on Thursday.
Dozens of transport workers protest and demand the convocation of a general assembly in their union section.
A group of residents from the village of Tidjounane, in Chemini, staged a sit-in in the municipal assembly to give voice to their grievances.
Around a hundred of residents protest over housing in Boumerdes.
Hundreds of residents of Bordj Menaiel took to the streets and expressed their discontent with local authorities.
Nine bunkers and several explosives were discovered and destroyed by the Algerian army in Tizi Ouzou.
Teachers protested and struck in Constantine over alleged unequal professional treatment.
Taxi drivers protested in Kouba against the decision of unifying the colours of taxi vehicles in town.

The municipality of Tizi Ouzou, including the main town and the villages around, was paralysed by a general strike. Dozens of protesters also gathered outside the town hall and demanded to meet the mayor.
A bomb exploded while a patrolling car of the Gendarmerie Nationale was transiting near the village of ""Erriha El-Beida"" in the daira of Beni Senous. A soldier was slightly injured in the face.
The deputy mayor of Besbes was killed by a man amidst protests over forced evictions in the area.

During a ambush near the locality of Ras Amahrane in El Milia, a detachment of the Peoples National Army of the operational area of Jijel (5th Military Region) killed, on 18 December 2015, a gunman and recovered a Kalashnikov submachine gun and a quantity of ammunition.
Hundreds of residents staged protests outside the offices of the local administration in Mila.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: The local transport company of Souk Ahras saw a new day of contestation as its workers staged a movement of protest on site. The protesters demand the renovation of positions within UGTA.
A group of residents from El Hamri neighbourhood took to the streets to protest against their exclusion from the recent allocations of public housing.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: A leading figure of the North African affiliate of al-Qaida has been killed in an ambush by Algerian soldiers. AQIM confirmed that Abu al-Hassan Rachid al-Bulaydi, head of the Sharia Committee, was killed on Friday. During the operation, another armed Islamist was also killed.
Other protests over dysfunctions in allocating public housing were recorded in Constantine on Sunday.
Around twenty people, including ex-soldiers who had applied for public housing, gathered in Oran to protest against the slowness in the allocation of accommodations.

Violence erupted during the second day of protests in Constantine. After police fired teargas to disperse the crowds, protesters clashed with officers. One polcieman was injured and seven protesters arrested.
Nearly 1000 SDE workers staged a sit-in in Batna to express their solidarity with their director, who had been aggressed by a court bailiff.
A group of residents from the village of Chaabet Roba gathered in protest outside the offices of the wilaya of Biskra and demanded to meet the governor over land and housing problems.
Students and teachers organized a sit-in in Taghit to voice their discontent with the degradation of the town following a tourist event.
Unionists and workers on Wednesday (January 6) protested in front of Sonelgaz (Algeria's state-owned gas and electricity utility company) calling for fair wages among other demands.
The residents of La Cumo shanty town in Es Senia blocked the tramway to protest and demand their relocation to better accommodations.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: Six post office workers blocked the Grande Poste in Constantine to denounce mismanagement.
Around 50 people, who had bought a house in Seddouk, staged a sit-in to denounce the failed delivery of their houses.
Disappointed by the degradation of their village, a group of residents from Douar Ouled Habib staged a sit-in outside the town hall in Sidi Khettab.
A group of people, who applied for public housing, occupied the town hall of El Ghomri for two consecutive days.
The residents of Soukies occupied the National Route 87 and started throwing stones on cars angered against the lack of water supply in their village.
A group of people, who applied for public housing, occupied the town hall of El Ghomri for two consecutive days.
An armed Islamist was killed on Tuesday by the Algerian army in the surroundings of Ziama-Manzouria, in Jijel.

column7: APJEA: Association for the Promotion of Young People and Employment in Arzew
column17: A sit-in was organised by young unemployed in the town of Arzew.
Public housing applicants demonstrated in Oran and demanded that their grievances are received by the authorities.

An armed militant was killed near Batna by the army. The operation also allowed elements of the ANP to recover a (FMPK) machine gun type, a quantity of ammunition (160 bullets), a pair of binoculars, five (5) mobile phones and other items.
Around fifteen university students staged a sit-in outside their campus in Bouira. They denounce the misbehavious of their facultys dean.
Hundreds of people protested in Tigzirt against high living costs.
Defusal: Four homemade bombs were discovered and destroyed Sunday by a detachment of the Peoples National Army in Bouira.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: The UGTA organised a sit-in outside the entrance of the wilaya in Tizi Ouzou to demand the reintegration of the director of Ouacifs health authority.

Dozens of citizens were hurt and one person was said to have died in the clashes that erupted between protesters calling for their living conditions to be improved and gendarmerie security forces in the governorates of Batna and Setif in the last two days. Oued El Maa, in Batna saw the most violent protests, as the town is isolated and in a state of siege. According to local medical sources, clashes between demonstrators and anti-riot forces led to 71 persons injured, and the family of an old woman who died said that she died because of the intense use of tear gas in the Belgasmi Jmoui district the day before yesterday evening [17 Jan].

Dozens of citizens were hurt and one person was said to have died in the clashes that erupted between protesters calling for their living conditions to be improved and gendarmerie security forces in the governorates of Batna and Setif in the last two days. Oued El Maa, in Batna saw the most violent protests, as the town is isolated and in a state of siege. According to local medical sources, clashes between demonstrators and anti-riot forces led to 71 persons injured, and the family of an old woman who died aged 92, said that she died because of the intense use of tear gas in the Belgasmi Jmoui district the day before yesterday evening [17 Jan].

Two people were badly injured in Souk El Khemis after the detonation of a bomb.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel
column17: Yesterday morning [19 January], hundreds of workers and citizens came out in a massive march in Bejaia, to express their rejection of the policy issued by the government to counter the drop in oil prices and extreme poverty. The march organized by the SNAPAP [National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel] started from the House of Culture in the Amouri neighbourhood and ended in a large gathering at the Said Mekbel Square.

""Police excesses"" were reported in the town of Ouel El Ma on January 20th. Several unauthorised operations were conducted after the fightings that erupted a few days earlier, and a woman was reportedly assaulted by police during a search.
ETUSSA workers strike and protested in the morning of January 20th over mismanagement and alleged corruption in the local administration and the trade unions.
Parents occupied a school in Zounina protesting against the conditions of the premises.
Students struck and paralysed Tizi Ouzou university.
Housing applicants protested in Ben Badis and demanded that the list of recipients is reviewed due to irregularities.
Housing applicants took to the streets in Oran to protest against the delays in the allocation of houses.
Scores of residents occupied the offices of the local council in Djendel. They protested against the inefficient allocation of housing in their village.

column7: UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: Teachers protested in the provinces of Skikda and Biskra.

column7: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: Teachers protested in the provinces of Skikda and Biskra.
A sit-in was staged by village residents during the week in Chabet El Ameur to protest against the lack of gas supply in their area.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Algerias army on Friday killed four armed Islamists in the northern province of Ain Defla who allegedly belonged to a group that carried out a deadly attack last year. Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM) claimed responsibility for that attack.
A protest movement took place on the 31st of January and the 1st of February in Khebouzia, where a group of disgruntled youth occupied the offices of the local administration for two days.
Local sources reported clashes between the army and militants in Yakouren area.
A protest movement took place on the 31st of January and the 1st of February in Khebouzia, where a group of disgruntled youth occupied the offices of the local administration for two days.
Residents of Azouza village occupied the town hall of Chabet El Ameur to demand the activation of gas supply in their area.

An IED has exploded on 1 February east of the city of Tizi Ouzou, injuring two military personnel who were patrolling the area. Local sources told El Watan that the IED was buried in the area after clashes between the army and militants the night before.
Job applicants gathered in protest in Tizi Ouzou to protest against the delay in launching the employment programme.
A group of traders protested against the prolonged duration of engineering works near their working place.
Parents protested outside one school in Torrich, a small village near Oued Lili.

The issue of the unemployed took a grave turn yesterday [9 February] when a number of young men who were protesting in Hassi Rmel outside the provincial governors headquarters sewed their lips together in a serious escalation unprecedented in all the protest action in the region since 2012 when what became known as the movement of the unemployed in the south began. Similar protest actions were reported in illizi and Tamanrasset.
Traders protested outside the offices of the Directorate of Commerce against the daily fiscal controls carried out by the authorities.

The issue of the unemployed took a grave turn yesterday [9 February] when a number of young men who were protesting in Hassi Rmel outside the provincial governors headquarters sewed their lips together in a serious escalation unprecedented in all the protest action in the region since 2012 when what became known as the movement of the unemployed in the south began. Similar protest actions were reported in illizi and Tamanrasset.
