Similar protest actions were reported in illizi and Tamanrasset.
Algerian army troops on Tuesday killed a militant in the northern province of Bouira.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel
column17: SNAPAP protested in Mascara and demanded a financial investigation over social expenses between 2005 and 2015.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: Doctors protested over mismanagement in Medea.
Algerian army troops on Saturday killed a militant in an ambush set up near the commune of Assi Youcef. A Kalashnikov submachine gun and ammunition were also retrieved.
Two militants were killed and two submachine guns were recovered Wednesday afternoon in the province of Boumerdes (50-km east of Algiers) by a detachment of the Peoples National Army.
Around 30 employees in a local water company staged a sit-in in town.
Journalists held a rally at the Tahar Djaout press house to condemn their unfair dismissal carried out without prior warning by the director of the publication the day before yesterday [15 February].
Residents protested in Biskra and demanded to meet the wali.

column7: UNEA: National Union of Algerian Students
column17: UNEA students protested in Batna for two days over alleged irregularities during the exams.
Young unemployed from Sebt, 40 km north-east of Tiaret, staged a sit-in for two days outside the offices of the town hall and denounced discrimination.

column7: UNEA: National Union of Algerian Students
column17: UNEA students protested in Batna for two days over alleged irregularities during the exams.
Young unemployed from Sebt, 40 km north-east of Tiaret, staged a sit-in for two days outside the offices of the town hall and denounced discrimination.

column7: CNDDC: National Committee for the Defence of the Rights of the Unemployed
column17: A group of unemployed staged a protest in Ouargla, southern Algeria. They cut themselves with knives and threatened suicide.
Students marched in Tizi Ouzou

column7: CNDDC: National Committee for the Defence of the Rights of the Unemployed
column17: Other protests erupted in Touggourt, where three members of CNDDC tried to set ablaze a truck and kill themselves. They then renounced to their action and were received by the wali of Touggourt.
The Peoples National Army (ANP) discovered and destroyed in Boumerdes, on 27 February 2016, a bunker containing 500 kilograms of explosive materials and 100 liters of nitric acid.
40 teachers protested in Oran on Sunday to demand the revision of their contract.
Residents blocked a route in Ben Chabane with burning tyres and trunks to protest against the isolation of their region.
Three unemployed tried to kill themselves in an act of protest staged in the offices of the local administration of Annaba.
Residents blocked the circulation of vehicles in Chlef to protest against the poor condition of their area.
Dozens of youth protested in Tolga on Monday against the construction of houses in their neighbourhood.

column7: SNPSP: National Union of Public Health Doctors; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: One hundred of doctors protested in Bechar against the deterioration of public health structures.

Algerian soldiers shot dead two armed Islamists on Tuesday in an operation some 125 kilometres (75 miles) southeast of the capital. The clash took place near Kadiria in the Bouira district. Two other militants belonging to the Algerian branch of the Islamic State were arrested on the following day near the site of the fighting.
Police slighlty injured some protesters in Bouira during a demonstration against an attempted demolition of unauthorised residential buildings.
Residents protested over housing in Oran.

Around twenty immigrants have been injured Wednesday by Algerian nationals that sparked following the murder of a resident of Said-Otba district in Ouargla. The confrontation broke out between the residents of Said-Otba district and nationals from different African countries, living temporarily in the area. The alleged killer of Said-Otbas resident, a 22-year-old man from Niger, was arrested by the judicial police two hours after the crime.
The residents of a bidonville staged a protest outside the offices of the local administration in Constantine and demanded new housing.
The citizens of Oued Slam gathered in protest outside their town hall to denounce the poor condition of their lives and the indifference of authorities.
A protest was also recorded in Bab El Oued where residents gathered outside the local administration over housing.
El Nasr slum residents protested in EL Hamiz and blocked the circulation of vehicles with burning tyres to express their dissatisfaction over the condition of housing.
Teachers protested in Constantine and demanded jobs.
One hundred of citizens of Ath Mansour protested outside the local administration over housing allocations.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: The Peoples National Army and National Gendarmerie forces recovered six Stinger shoulder-fired ground-to-air missiles in an operation near the Tunisian border in which three suspected jihadists were killed. The operation took place in the Guemar district at the road between the provincial capital, El Oued, and Kouinine Municipality, on Thursday evening. The militants included an AQIM commander.
Residents of Oued Sly protested over marginalisation. Police intervened and dispersed the rally peacefully.

A militant leader who joined the Islamic State group was killed in an army operation in the Oued-Sebt area of Gouraya region. Mouloud Baal, also known as Abou El Moundhir, joined IS in 2015. A Kalashnikov submachine gun and two grenades were seized in the operation.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Rockets on Friday struck an Algerian gas plant run by foreign energy giants in an attack claimed by Al-Qaeda. No casualties were reported.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Algerias army has killed four militants authorities believe were responsible for Fridays attack on the Krechba gas facility operated by state oil company Sonatrach with BP and Statoil. The Algerian defence ministry has not yet confirmed the operation.
A group of at least 30 employees in the Directorate for Commerce protested in Saida over mismanagement.

Algerian soldiers killed six suspected Islamist militants in an area near the Tunisian border on Monday. The operation took place near El Oued and resulted in the seizure of five Kalashnikov assault rifles, three machine guns and an automatic pistol. The ministry did not link the operation to an assault on Friday claimed by Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb on a gas plant in Krechba further south. The militants were later indicated as affiliated to Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade.

column7: CNCV: National Coordination of Contractual Teachers
column17: Teachers protested in central Algiers on Monday. Police intervened and arrested dozens on site.
Merchants protested in Biskra and blocked the circulation of vehicles in the city centre.

column7: CNCV: National Coordination of Contractual Teachers
column17: Police in Algiers beat teachers demonstrating for greater job security on March 21 and 22, 2016, injuring at least two. Police also arrested dozens of protesters and held them for several hours, then released them without charge. The teachers, who are hired on temporary contracts rather than being given permanent posts, took to the streets after a call by the National Coordination of Contractual Teachers, an independent, nonunion group, for a sit-in to demand integration of teachers into the civil service to provide greater job security. A ban on public demonstrations has been in force in the capital since 2001.

A militant was killed by police forces of the locality of Maatkas, 20km south of Tizi Ouzou. According to local security sources, the man, who was wearing an explosive belt, was trying to escape a combing operation by units of the Peoples National Army in the region.

Around 30 former ""patriots"" gathered outside the local wilaya in Bouira and staged a march to voice their discontent with neglect and marginalisation on the part of the government. In particular, they demanded the appreciation of their pensions and pensions for veterans and widows.

column7: UGCAA: General Union of Algerian Merchants and Artisans
column17: 116 fruit sellers affiliated to UGCAA staged a protest movement on Wednesday in Abou Tachfine. They denounced the mismanagement of the local entreprise.
Residents protested over housing in Saida.
Three militants were killed on Saturday in Tadmait after a searching operation in a forest nearby.
Teachers started a protest march in Bejaia, arriving after 8 days in Boumerdes where they staged a sit-in outside the Education Directorate.
In the southeast province of El Oued, near the Tunisian border, army forces killed on Sunday an Islamist militant qualified as ""dangerous"".
On Monday, residents of a slum in Ain Benian burnt tyres and blocked the circulation in town over housing problems. Police forces erected checkpoints and isolated the area.

Another Islamist was killed in the forest of Sidi Ali Bounab on Monday, two days after three others were killed in the near Tadmait and bringing to 12 the number of gunmen killed by security forces in a week.
Young unemployed sellers protested on Wednesday outside the wilaya of Tebessa and demanded that their stands in the local town market were reassigned.
Two policemen were reportedly injured in Tiaret during clashes with residents of a slum. The rioters protested over forced demolitions.

Movement of forces: Algerian forces begin combing operations in border areas deploying over 14,000 military personnel. The military command also decided to move an additional 20,000 military personnel from bases in the north to the south. An informed security source said that the military reinforcements which had been moved would be placed at hundreds of military bases and monitoring points on the border with Niger, Mali and Libya as well as used to control the main points of the secret desert paths and tracks used by smugglers and combatants.

Journalists were attacked at a FLN meeting in Algiers by members of the security personnel. The attackers were described as ""mysterious thugs"" who appear at every important FLN activity. The SNJ said the journalists found themselves facing a sort of militia of unknown origin comprised of thugs who acted as ""stewards"" for whom the organizers and the large number of security services that were present did not take responsibility.
Teachers started a protest march in Bejaia, arriving after 8 days in Boumerdes where they staged a sit-in outside the Education Directorate.
A sit-in staged by retired teachers started on April 3 and was finally dispersed on April 15. The protesting teachers went on hunger strike during the sit-in.
Teachers staged a protest outside the Education directorate in Oran.

The army killed from three to four Islamist militants in the eastern province of El Oued. Four Kalashnikov automatic weapons, grenades and ammunition were also seized during the military-led operation in the Bir El Kasira area, near the Tunisian border. Algerie Presse Service reported three militants killed, while AFP four.
Garbage collectors protested against nepotism and mismanagement outside the wilaya in Tebessa.
Residents of two villages in Ath Lakser protested outside the town hall demanding development.
Residents of Ibn Sina slum in Oran rioted Thursday and Friday. No clashes with police deployed in the area were reported.
Residents of Ibn Sina slum in Oran rioted Thursday and Friday. No clashes with police deployed in the area were reported.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers; Labour Group (Algeria)
column17: Hundreds of SETE workers staged a sit-in in Bejaia outside the Education directorate. On Sunday, railway workers also started a strike in Bejaia.
Dozens of workers staged a protest in the university campus of Ksar Chellala, 116 km east of Tiaret.They denounced to have been excluded from recruitment processes.

Dozens of young unemployed staged a protest in Illizi to claim the right to work. While they were trying to prevent workers from entering the premises of the wilaya, police intervened and arrested ten protesters.
40 workers protested near Sidi Bel Abbes to express their discontent with the degradation of their town area.
A militant described as dangerous"" was killed by the army in Beni Abbes, province of Bordj Bou Arreridj.

column7: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: Teachers also staged a sit-in in Boumerdes, supported by trade unions.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers; SNTE: National Union of Education Workers
column17: CNAPESTE and SNTE protested in Djelfa to support the teachers fight.

column7: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers; SNTE: National Union of Education Workers; CLA: High Schools Council of Algeria
column17: Three trade unions staged a protest in Oran.
Four soldiers were killed near Constantine in an attack carried out by armed militants, the day before the visit of the PM in the region.
A sit-in staged by retired teachers started on April 3 and was finally dispersed on April 15. The protesting teachers went on hunger strike during the sit-in.

Security and gendarmerie forced broke up a peaceful sit-in of teachers from Maydan Alendemaj, or 'Bbodeao Boumerdes' as they call it, on Monday morning. The security authorities surrounded the place at three in the morning and forced teachers to leave, which led to a clash causing minor injuries in the ranks of teachers. Authorities ordered the protesters to convene at Kharruba station in the capital and to bus them to the states. According to the source protesters left the bus they were traveling on along the Bordj Bou Arreridj highway, and they cut off the road in Alyashir, deploring the decision by Ministry of Interior's to break up the protest.

column7: SNCCOPEN: National Union of Common Bodies and Professional Workers in Public Education; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: A sit-in was organised in Mostaganem by an education-related trade union to demand a new national contract.
Near the central town of Ghardaia, unidentified attackers threw molotov cocktails and fired bullets against a bus carrying immigrants. Some of the passengers were injured in the attack.

column7: FNTF: National Federation of Finance Workers
column17: The FNTF organised a one-day protest on the national territory to claim their socio-economic rights and an improvement in their working conditions.
An armed man was killed near In Guezzam by army units. He wasidentified as a militant.

Dozens of young people gathered in protested outside the offices of the urban security in El Esnam to demand the punishment of an officer who allegedly assaulted a man. The police chief denied the event, saying that the officer was assaulted by a drunk man.
Students protested in Adrar

column7: UGEL: General Union of Free Students
column17: Students affiliated to UGEL attacked other students in the Department of Amazigh Language and Culture in Bouira with batons and chaines. Dozens of students were injured in the raid.
A detachment of the Peoples National Army killed two militants and recovered weapons and munitions in the province of Boumerdes (50-km east of Algiers) on Thursday.
Fruit sellers protest in Salah Bouachour, Skikda, closing down the offices of the local administration.

Algerian troops on Friday killed three armed Islamist fighters in the Skidda region west of the capital during an operation in the area. AFP reported the following week that the fatalities toll include four Islamists killed.
Farmers protested in Babar against delays in the implementation of development programmes.
A seventh Islamist was killed in the same week by the Algerian army near Kerkra.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Security sources revelead that the Peoples National Army forces in the operational sector of El Oued Province eliminated the commander of armament of Al-Qaeda in the Land of the Islamic Maghreb [AQLIM], the so-called Chounoufi Mohamed Ech Cherif, aka Loukman Abi Mohamed, together with two senior emirs in the organization, the emir of Chaambi [mountains on the border between Algeria and Tunisia] Khalifa Markhi, aka Aba Nasir, and the emir of a detachment active in El Ma el Abyadea. The sources said that they were eliminated after they oversaw operations of smuggling arms and taking them to Algeria.
A protest saw dozens of housing applicants staging a demonstration outside the local administration offices in Oran.
In Constantine a protest was staged against illegal taxi drivers.
Strikes: Workers in the transport sector struck and interrupted service on Sunday in Algiers, Oran, Constantine and Chlef.
Residents of Errefaya shut down the local administration offices.
In a second day of protest, residents of Oran took to the streets to denounce the situation of public housing.
Public housing beneficiaries gathered in Ain Arnat to protest delays in the allocation of residences.

Algerian soldiers on a search operation have killed seven armed Islamist extremists in the province of Bouira. A statement by the Defense Ministry said the soldiers killed the seven on Wednesday in Lakhdaria, some 120 kilometers (75 miles) from Algiers. They also recovered a cache of arms, including automatic pistols, rifles and loaded chargers, as well as eight cell phones.

column7: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: Teachers protested in Bachir Ibrahimi university of Bordj Bou Arreridj.
Veterinarians protested outside the local administration in Tiaret.
Young residents blocked the roads of Bouzbaier, in laghouat province.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Two armed militants have been killed and weapons have been recovered Monday by a detachment of the Peoples National Army, following an ambush near the commune of Tadmait, in the province of Tizi Ouzou. Among the militants killed there was also the AQIM emir Benari Abderrahmane, alias Souheib, who commanded the El Farouk brigade in Tizi Ouzou.
Paramedics protested in the hospital of El Eulma over mismanagement and lack of transparency.
Slum residents in Oran took to the streets to protest evictions.
A hundred residents of Sissaoui blocked the circulation of vehicles across the village after a car accident that killed a child.
200 residents of Ain el Hammam protested against rising prices.
Private security agents protested outside the offices of Sonatrach HQ in Arzew.

A detachment of the Army killed an armed Islamist militant, in the morning of 17 May 2016, following a clash near the Errich woods, in the commune of Ain Turk, the province of Bouira. According to Liberte, the militants killed were three and they all pledged allegiance to ISIS. Two more bodies of militants killed during the operation launched by the army on 17 May were discovered in the same Errich area on 25 June.

The forces of the Peoples National Army (ANP) on Thursday killed another militant in the combing operation led by near the Errich woods, in the commune of Ain Turk, in the province of Bouira. According to Liberte, the militants killed were three and they all pledged allegiance to ISIS.

column7: SNCCOPEN: National Union of Common Bodies and Professional Workers in Public Education; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: A sit-in was staged in Mostaganem by education workers affiliated to SNCCOPEN.

Algerian army killed six militants on Saturday during a wide scale dragging operation in the northern province of Bouira, in the Ain Turk area. Eight militants have been killed and one captured alive since the counter-terrorism operation was launched on Tuesday.

A detachment of the Peoples National Army killed three armed militants on Monday during a combing operation near the forest of Errich, in the province of Bouira. They have been identified and had reportedly join militant groups back in 1993. They were part of an AQIM battalion who had joined the Jund al Khilafa group recently.
Around 50 Patriots protested in Biskra and demanded higher pensions.
Around 200 workers protested in Oran against a new bill proposed by Health Minister Boudiaf.
Eight suspected militants were killed in the forests near El Eulma by the Algerian army. The group was moving south from Jijel province when they were ambushed by soldiers near El Eulma.
Public sector workers protested in Tizi Ouzou.
A group of residents from Ahfir village shut down the offices of the local administration in Imsouhal.
Angry residents blocked the city centre of Constantine for two days in a row against evictions in their neighbourhood.
Theatre workers protested in Mostaganemn against the appointment of a new ministerial delegate for theatre art.
Angry residents blocked the city centre of Constantine for two days in a row against evictions in their neighbourhood.
Demonstrators demanded more security in Ouacifs.
Taxi drivers protested in Azzaba.

Four militants were killed Wednesday following an ambush in Rouakeche, in the town of Baata, province of Medea, by a detachment of the People's National Army (ANP). The militants were allegedely responsible for the killing of a French tourist in 2014.
Algerian soldiers have killed two armed Islamists in an operation near the commune of Taza, west of Jijel. guns, ammunition and improvised explosive devices were also found.
Protesters shut down the local administration of Akbou denouncing the lack of transparency of the local government.

column9: MAK: Movement for the Autonomy of Kabylie
column17: The town of Larbaa Nath Irathen witnessed confrontations between police forces and MAK following an attempt by members of the movement for the autonomy of Kabylie known as MAK to raise the flag adopted for their state. Members of the MAK having chosen the opposite square to the old headquarters of the National Gendarmerie brigade marched through the streets of downtown, chanting their anti-""regime"" slogans which call for the independence of Kabylie. Security forces intervened to abort their attempts following confrontations between the two sides through the use of stones and batons.

Detonation/Demolition: A detachment of the ANP discovered and destroyed, on June 16, 2016 in Skikda and Jijel (5th Military Region), a shelter for militants, 12 handcrafted bombs and 05 mortars, a quantity of explosives, detonation tools and food products

Fourteen armed Islamists were killed in the weekend near Rouakeche, which was the site of other clashes on June 8. A total of eighteen Islamists were killed in the two operations. The militants were allegedely responsible for the killing of a French tourist in 2014.

Fourteen armed Islamists were killed in the weekend near Rouakeche, which was the site of other clashes on June 8. A total of eighteen Islamists were killed in the two operations. The militants were allegedely responsible for the killing of a French tourist in 2014.
More than 120 workers in a Sonelgaz plant near Ghardaia staged a pacific sit-in in Bouhraoua during the weekend.
A group of residents blocked the circulation of vehicles in a neighbourhood of Constantine after their house went on fire.
Protesters gathered in Bouira to denounce shortage of publich housing.
Clashes were reported in Annaba between police and informal traders. Violence began after police intervened to clamp down on street sellers.
A group of people demanding public housing staged a protest in Oran

A shootout took place in the village of Bouhalouane, near Bordj Tahar, between the army and an alleged militant with his family. The militant shot at the army, which reacted injuring his wife and a child. Three of his daughters were arrested, while he managed to escape.
In a rally Friday evening, dozens of intellectuals and artists gathered in Algiers to call for their release of a journalist detained near Algiers.

A detachment of the ANP eliminated on 8 July 2016 one militant following an ambush set in the area of Tiana (El Tayana), located in the town of El Milia and recovered a Kalashnikov type automatic pistol and a quantity of ammunition.
The population of Oued Taga protested on Friday against the installation of a company in their town. A sit-in and a peaceful march gathered over fifteen thousand people.
Several residents of Ain Fares, wilaya of Mascara, took to the streets to protest shale gas exploitation around the region.

Ten people were injured during clashes between young people and subsaharan immigrants in Tamanrasset. The violence erupted during the football final of Euro 2016 and quickly escalated in stone-throwing until afternoon the next day. Riots also spread in various neighbourhoods of the desert town and were contained by the intervention of security forces who restored order.
Dozens of Tizi Ouzou residents marched in protest on Sunday to demand the improvement of the security situation in town.

column7: SNAPEST: National Union of Secondary and Technical Education Teachers; SNTE: National Union of Education Workers; CLA: High Schools Council of Algeria
column17: Trade unions staged a protest in Mascara to denounce neglect over the working conditions of teachers.

Ten people were injured during clashes between young people and subsaharan immigrants in Tamanrasset. The violence erupted during the football final of Euro 2016 and quickly escalated in stone-throwing until afternoon the next day. Riots also spread in various neighbourhoods of the desert town and were contained by the intervention of security forces who restored order.
A sit-in was held in the Kabyle town of Bejaia. Demonstrators were protesting to defend freedom of speech. Another similar protest movement was held two days earlier.
Residents of a village named El Majen shut down the local administration in Aomar and part of the road nearby to protest the dealys in the implementation of infrastructure projects.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: The administrative staff of the Directorate for Agricultural Services gathered in protest on Tuesday to denounce the managements failure in respecting their promises over improving working conditions.
A sit-in was held in the Kabyle town of Bejaia. Demonstrators were protesting to defend freedom of speech. Another similar protest movement was held two days earlier.
Social housing applicants protested in Djidiouia over delays.
Civil society groups rallied in protest in Tizi Ouzou.

Algerian military forces on Tuesday killed an armed militant in the upper woods of the province of Tizi Ouzou, 120 km eastern Algiers. The troops launched a wide scale operation in Bouzeguene, eastern Tizi Ouzou, as they recovered a Kalashnikov submachine gun, a quantity of ammunition and binoculars. The source noted that the operation is still underway.

Algerian military forces on Friday killed an Islamist militant in the upper woods of Boumerdes province. The militant was identified as B. Reda, alias Abu Shihab, who joined armed groups in 2006. An automatic gun, a grenade and ammunition were retrieved.
Algerians demanding public housing protested on Saturday outside the Ministry of Housing in Algiers.

Demolition: 27 suspected militant bunkers were destroyed in Tizi Ouzou and two other provinces, Boumerdes and Bejaia. Militants affiliated with al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb and the recently established Islamic State affiliated group named ""Caliphate Soldiers"" are believed to be hiding in dense forests in northern Algeria.

Demolition: 27 suspected militant bunkers were destroyed in Tizi Ouzou and two other provinces, Boumerdes and Bejaia. Militants affiliated with al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb and the recently established Islamic State affiliated group named ""Caliphate Soldiers"" are believed to be hiding in dense forests in northern Algeria.

Demolition: 27 suspected militant bunkers were destroyed in Tizi Ouzou and two other provinces, Boumerdes and Bejaia. Militants affiliated with al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb and the recently established Islamic State affiliated group named ""Caliphate Soldiers"" are believed to be hiding in dense forests in northern Algeria.
A group of residents of Oum Teboul protested against insecurity in late July following the death of a man hit by a cross-border smuggler.
The port of Bejaia was paralyzed by a sit-in organised by local drivers. Police was dispatched to the protest site without intervening directly.

Arms caches containing projectiles and explosive-making tools were destroyed by detachments of the Peoples National Army in the provinces of Tizi Ouzou and Skikda on Sunday. Army detachments discovered and destroyed, in Azazga, in the province Tizi Ouzou (1st Military Region) and Skikda (5th Military Region) on 31 July 2016, arms caches containing two mines, a bomb, four homemade projectiles, a mortar shell, a grenade, a power generator and explosive-making tools.
Algerians protested peacefully in the border passage of Ras Laayoune after that the Tunisian government introduced a new tax charging Algerians who enter Tunisia.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.
Residents of Oued El Abtal blocked the national route with stones and burning tyres to protest repeated interruptions in water supplies.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.

Two caches containing 13 homemade guns, 8 bombs, 10kg of explosives and detonation means were discovered and destroyed by a detachment of the Peoples National Army (ANP) during a combing operation at Sidi Ali Bounab forest located in the province of Boumerdes. The day after, five more homemade guns and three bombs have been destroyed during a second combing operation conducted by forces of the Peoples National Assembly (ANP) in Sidi Ali Bounab.
A group of young people from Adrar have blocked access to a gas site near Adrar for six days, preventing local workers from accessing or quitting the premises.

Algerian tourists continued to protest against the new tax on foreign vehicles introduced by the Tunisian government. Demonstrations were reported in the border passaes of Betita and Ras El Aioun in Tebessa province.

Algerian tourists continued to protest against the new tax on foreign vehicles introduced by the Tunisian government. Demonstrations were reported in the border passaes of Betita and Ras El Aioun in Tebessa province.
Around 40 people protested in Saida demanding public housing.
Young Algerians protested outside the Tunisian consulate in Tebessa against the tax on foreign vehicles introduced by the Tunisian government.

Three caches for militants containing homemade bombs, one RPG-7 rocket and explosives have been destroyed Tuesday by detachments of the Peoples National Army (ANP) in the provinces of Jijel and Boumerdes
The town of Mascara saw protests as residents blocked the National Route 6 after repeated cuts to water supplies. Date not confirmed - likely to be during the weekend.
The streets near Oued Lili were blocked by demonstrators to protest against the transformation of an industry nearby.
Residents blocked a road just outside Mascara demanding the reactivation of water supplies.

Property destruction: detachments of the ANP discovered and destroyed on 22 August 2016 eighteen homemade bombs during a combing operation in the zone of Oued Bousfissaf, located in the town of El-Khroub (province of Constantine).
The army killed an Islamist militant in Guedjati, Batna province.
A group of people living in the mountainous village of Bouchakour blocked the national route 68 connecting Issers to Chabet El Ameur to protest against regular cuts to water supplies in their region.

Property destruction: Three (03) bunkers, one cannon, eleven homemade bombs and detonation tools were destroyed Wednesday, by detachments of the Peoples National Army in combing operations in Tizi Ouzou.
Residents of Adni protested and shut down the town hall of Irdjen denouncing the worsening life conditions in their village.

Scores of unemployed youths from different parts of the town of Ouargla [eastern Algeria] staged a protest action against their dire living situation. A group of them climbed up to the roof of the Provincial headquarters threatening to kill themselves and demanding employment, while others seized two tankers of fuel across the road between Rouissat and Ain Beida Municipalities.
Driving school owners staged a protest in Ain el Turk and blocked the circulation of vehicles in town.

Scores of unemployed youths from different parts of the town of Ouargla [eastern Algeria] staged a protest action against their dire living situation. A group of them climbed up to the roof of the Provincial headquarters threatening to kill themselves and demanding employment, while others seized two tankers of fuel across the road between Rouissat and Ain Beida Municipalities.
A military official died in Azzefoun after hitting a landmine hidden under the soil.
Riots were reported in Ain Benian, where demonstrators threw stones at police forces. The violence erupted after an attempted eviction.
A group of citizens from Tala Hiba shut down the local administration in Toudja protesting against cuts to water supplies.
Residents set a train on fire after a man was hit and killed on the railway.
Parents of students protested in Ath Lakser, 20 km southeast of Bouira, against the degradation of school premises. They staged a sit-in outside a school.
Demolition: A shelter and 13 homemade bombs have been destroyed Wednesday in Tizi Ouzou, Chlef and Constantine during joint combing operations by a detachment of the Peoples National Army (ANP).
Demolition: A shelter and 13 homemade bombs have been destroyed Wednesday in Tizi Ouzou, Chlef and Constantine during joint combing operations by a detachment of the Peoples National Army (ANP).
Protests against cuts to water supplies were reported in Daia Ben Dahoua, near Ghardaia. Water is reported to have been missing for twelve days. Residents burnt tyres and blocked vehicles.
A peaceful sit-in was held in Oran to denounce increasing violence against women.
Repeated cuts to water supplies triggered protests in Biskra, as dozens of families took to the streets on Monday and Wednesday.
Repeated cuts to water supplies triggered protests in Biskra, as dozens of families took to the streets on Monday and Wednesday.
Medical patients suffering from kidney failure protested in the hospital of Bouira.
Residents protested against pollution outside a factory in Ghazaouet, Tlemcen.
A protest was staged outside the wilaya of Bouira by parents of pupils.
The residents of Ath Wizgan occupied the administrative offices of the town in Bouzeguene to protest against water shortages.
Parents pf pupils shut down a school in Taghzout
Demolition: Four (4) bunkers and 4 homemade bombs were destroyed Sunday by detachments of the Peoples National Army (ANP) in Tizi Ouzou, Boumerdes, Ain Defla and Batna
Demolition: Four (4) bunkers and 4 homemade bombs were destroyed Sunday by detachments of the Peoples National Army (ANP) in Tizi Ouzou, Boumerdes, Ain Defla and Batna

Social houring recipients staged a protest in Larbaa Nath Irathen.
Local merchants protested in Mascara over the failed repayment of damages following the demolition of the old market.
Demolition: Three (03) bunkers and twenty-three (23) homemade bombs were destroyed Tuesday, in Boumerdes and Batna, by detachments of the People's National Army
The army killed a militant in the locality of Menaceur, Tipaza province.
A group of around 50 young women protested in Adrar province demanding jobs, rigged recruitment in the public service and the failed construction of a hospital.
Unemployed youth marched in protest in the southern town of Ouargla.

Algerian counterterrorism troops killed on Sunday night two armed militants in the province of Medea, 145 km southwest of Algiers. The two militants were killed in an ambush set up in the woods of Boghar, as the troops retrieved a Kalashnikov machine gun, a quantity of ammunition, a grenade, binoculars and six mobile phones
The suspected kidnapping of a young woman triggered riots in Souk Ahras. Tyres were burnt and roadblocks erected during the night between Sunday and Monday.
Parents of students protested in Souk Ahras against mismanagement in the education sector.
Property destruction: An Army detachment destroyed, on 26 September 2016, eleven bunkers and two homemade bombs in Batna.
Parents of students protested in Souk Ahras against mismanagement in the education sector.
Students protested on Wednesday in Adekar.

column9: CNFD: National Coordination of the Families of the Missing
column17: A peaceful demonstration organised by the National Coordination of the Families of the Missing was violently disperse by the police who beat up and arrested the protesters in central Algiers.
Algerian counterterrorism forces on Thursday killed five armed militants in Tazoult area of Batna province. Troops have managed to retrieve machine guns and large quantity of ammunition.
Tensions were reported in In Guezzam as residents set tyres on fire and erected roadblocks after soldiers accidentally killed a suspected smuggler.
Teachers staged a protest in a high school of Ain el Turk
Parents of pupils staged a protest sit-in outside a school in Adrar.
Protests were recorded during the week outside the Directorate of Tourim in Skikda and the town halls of Chreaia and Beni Oulbene.
Protests were recorded during the week outside the Directorate of Tourim in Skikda and the town halls of Chreaia and Beni Oulbene.
Residents of Haret El Oued and Haret Jawad gathered in protest on Thursday lack of potable water, disfunctioning rubbish collection and the worsening conditions of their neighbourhoods.
Protests were recorded during the week outside the Directorate of Tourim in Skikda and the town halls of Chreaia and Beni Oulbene.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Djamel Hanneb, a member of AQIM close to its leader Abdelmalek Droukdel, was killed on Thursday by the Algerian army in the region of Boumerdes. He joined the armed struggle in early 1990s.
Four armed Islamists were killed Friday in an Algerian army operation in Azzefoun, Tizi Ouzou region, 110 kilometres (70 miles) east of Algiers.

Scores of activists of the National Liberation Front [FLN] gathered in the central square at Sebdou, Tlemcen Province, on Saturday [8 October], in a protest demonstration to condemn what they described as ""irresponsible statements by the FLN Secretary-General Amar Saadani""

column7: UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees
column17: A group of protesters affiliated to UNPEF staged a protest on Monday in Skikda. A day before, UNPEF members staged a protest in Beni Oulbane.
Patients staged a sit-in in the hospital of Oran.

column7: UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees
column17: A group of protesters affiliated to UNPEF staged a protest on Monday in Skikda. A day before, UNPEF members staged a protest in Beni Oulbane.
Teachers held a sit-in outside a school in central Tiaret.
Oran University professors gathered in protest outside the offices of the wilaya.
Workers in Algiers transport company entered on strike and paralysed traffic circulation in the capital.

column16: Xinhua; Algeria Press Service; Jeune Afrique
column17: Two senior members of Islamic State (IS) group were killed Thursday near the commune of Oued Zehour in the province of Skikda. One of the two IS members was identified as Habbech Saddek, known as Abu Dujana, chief of IS in the eastern Algeria.
Dozens of residents from the village of Ghlal, on Oued Lili, interrupted during the weekend the circulation of vehicles in the province of Tiaret.
Property destruction: One bunker used by militants and containing 6 home-made bombs was destroyed Sunday in Skikda by a detachment of the Peoples National Army.
Strikes: Trade unions organised a nationwide strike on Monday and Tuesday. The rate of striking public sector workers was as high as 70% among healh workers and at 16% in the education sector.
The Gendarmerie dispersed protesters who were disrupting the circulation of vehicles between Ain Hadid and Frenda.
Unemployed protested in Babar to demand the opening of a branch of the National Office for Employment.
Hundreds of communal guards protested in Bejaia against marginalisation.
Police peacefully dispersed a protest sit-in organised by teachers in Bouira.

Property destruction: One shelter for militants and seven (07) homemade bombs were destroyed Thursday in Boumerdes by a detachment of the Peoples National Army, in coordination with the services of the National Police
Protesters staged a sit-in outside the town hall to demand the resignation of the FLN-affiliated mayor. Sit-in lasted for three days; coded the first day only.

column7: CNDDC: National Committee for the Defence of the Rights of the Unemployed
column17: On Monday, residents of Ouargla, supported by the CNDDC, called for the boycott of electricity bills during a demonstration organised between the offices of Sonelgaz and the prefecture.
Residents protested in the town hall over marginalisation.
Villagers protested insecurity in ordj Menaiel.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel; UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers; SNPSP: National Union of Public Health Doctors
column17: Medical staff workers protested in Ali Mendjeli on Thursday.
Residents protested against high electricity bills in Biskra.
Protests against rise in electricity bills continue in Biskra and in the nearby locality of Chetma. Roadblocks were erected on Friday and Saturday and tyres burnt.
Protests against rise in electricity bills continue in Biskra and in the nearby locality of Chetma. Roadblocks were erected on Friday and Saturday and tyres burnt.
A group of twenty butan gas sellers protested in El Fedjoudj against the deteriorating quality of gas they trade.

A policeman was killed on Saturday by three armed men in the province of Constantine, while investigators believe the assailants are members of the Islamic State. Three unidentified gunmen entered a restaurant in the Ziadia district of Constantine, directly targeting a policeman seated at the restaurant. Three bullets were reportedly fired against the policeman, hit by at least one lethal shot in the chest from what is said to be an automatic weapon. The gunmen also seized the policeman's gun in the attack.
Protests against rise in electricity bills continue in Biskra and in the nearby locality of Chetma. Roadblocks were erected on Friday and Saturday and tyres burnt.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel; UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers; SNPSP: National Union of Public Health Doctors
column17: Hundreds of municipal workers took part in a protest march organised by SNAPAP in Tizi Ouzou.

90 municipal workers have staged a two-week sit-in outside the local administration office in Bechar. They denounced the violations perpetrated by the local government.

Demonstrators blocked access to the offices of the local administration twice during the week, one of which on Saturday. They demand the local governor is dismissed over mismanagement.

Entrepreneurs protested peacefully in Chlef.

Violent clashes between Algerian police and protesters in Tikobaine, a small village near Tizi-Ouzou in Kabylie, took place on Friday November 4 after several days of discontent surrounding the lack of social housing. Protesters rallied to protest and asking for social housing in front of the local police station, as reported by Le360. Police responded by using tear gas against the protesters, leading to more violence.

Three people, two of whom were soldiers, had their throats cut early Monday morning in a fake road block in Ain Defla. The two soldiers were headed back to their barrack late on Sunday night aboard a taxi when they stopped at what they initially thought was a security checkpoint. They were, however, surprised by an armed group that set the vehicle on fire. The attack also claimed the life of a civilian. The incident occurred between Bir Ould Khelifa and Tariq Ibn Zyad.
Residents rioted in Tizi Ouzou after the release of public housing beneficiaries lists.
Defusal: Seven bunkers for armed militants, explosives factory and 44 home-made bombs were discovered and destroyed in Bouira on Tuesday by a detachment of the Peoples National Army (ANP)

Several people were injured in clashes that erupted on Thursday in Zmalet Emir Abdelkader, Tiaret province. The clashes involved armed men from Ouled Embarek tribe and were sparked after a member of the community began to work in a field contested by another community group.
Public housing applicants staged a protest outside the local administration offices in Ain Temouchent.
A protest sit-in organised by housing applicants has interrupted the circulation of vehicles near Akbou.

Security forces arrested Today dozens of participants in the strike organized by municipal workers in Bouira. Security also closed all the ways to the city to prevent the protesters from reaching the building.

Students protested over to days against the shortening of winter holidays.
Milk producers staged a sit-in outside the offices of the local administration of Batna. On the same day, public transport workers launched a general strike in town.

Youths from Skikda barricaded the road between Skikda and Filfila. Trunks and stones were used to disrupt the circulation of vehicles in the area. No police intervention was reported.
Protesters held a sit-in outside the Culture Palace in Skikda. They demanded the dismissal of the Director over alleged abuses at work.

An eight-year-old child was killed on Monday when an abandoned homemade bomb exploded in the locality of Mouzaia, in the province of Blida. The explosion injured seven other children aged between seven and 10, who were rushed to Frantz Fanon Hospital to get medical treatment. The bomb was likely abandoned by militant groups, given that the mountains and woods of the province of Blida used to be stronghold for militants in the 1990.
500 workers in the education sector in the province of Relizane demanding the payment of their pensions.

Algeria has witnessed a series of riots across the country after the Budget Law 2017, which includes tax hikes and austerity measures, entered into force. A call for a three-day strike starting from Sunday was largely followed in some regions, including Bejaia, 280 km in the east of the capital Algiers. Some angry youngsters on Monday took to the streets, looted some stores, burned out public properties and clashed with anti-riot forces in Bejaia. Clashes between youngsters and security forces, however, were reported on Wednesday, as several protesters were arrested pending trial. Other towns involved in the riots were Sidi Aich, Taskriout, Tichy, Akbou, El Akseur, Souk El Tenine, Saharidji.

column16: AFP; AP; El Watan (Algeria); Algeria Press Service
column17: Algeria's government says military forces have killed 14 suspected extremists in an ongoing operation in one of the country's last Islamic militant holdouts. The Defense Ministry said in a statement that nine were killed Friday and five others Wednesday around Bouira, 100 kilometers (60 miles) east of the capital, Algiers. The militants are estimated to be sixteen belonging to the Jund al Khilafa organisation. Five soldiers were also killed in the first stages of the assault.

Two policemen were injured Sunday evening in an attack on the 13th urban police station of the province Constantine in Bab El Kantara district. A policeman, who was in front of the police station located under in a building with dozens of families, counterattacked and detonated the explosive belt worn by the attacker. A loud explosion was heard near the police station. The Islamic State jihadist group claimed responsibility on Monday.
Two militants and one soldier were killed as clashes broke out in Maatkas on Monday.

The Algerian army ""neutralised"" nine Islamists in the North African country's restive eastern Kabylie region on Tuesday, seizing weapons and ammunition. The clashes took place near Azzefoun, a coastal town 170 kilometres (105 miles) east of Algiers. In the operation, four militants were killed and five arrested.
Rifle owners protested in Bouira after their weapons were seized by authorities.
A group of proters organised a sit-in outside the Minisrty of Justice in Algiers. The demonstration was dispersed peacefully by police.

Two armed Islamists were killed in an army operation in Dellys, 80 kilometres (50 miles) from Algiers, on Monday. Two other Islamists were captured and two Kalashnikovs and two automatic guns seized.

Algerian soldiers fired at a Sahrawi who had lost his way near the Tindouf camps, in southwestern Algeria. The man left one of the Tindouf camps, known as 'Laayoune camp', for a car ride with a friend before they were targeted by the Algerian soldiers and shot at. The Algerian soldiers shot without firing a warning shot in the air. One Sahrawi killed

column7: SNATEGZ: National Autonomous Union of Sonelgaz Workers
