Algerian army forces have killed an armed militant near the locality of Gouraya, in the west of Tipaza. The troops retrieved a Kalashnikov submachine gun, a loaded magazine, a homemade grenade, a pair of binoculars and four mobile phones, noted the source, adding that this operation is still underway. The killed gunman is a senior official at the Islamic State (IS) affiliated group Jund al-Khilafa.
Around sixty workers in a cement factory in Skikda province protested in the town of Bekkouche Lakhdar to opposed salary reductions.
Around one hundred demonstrators from Ksar Mansour staged a peaceful sit-in in Adrar.
Hundreds of residents protested in Ben Badis during the visit of the local administrator.
A group of people who applied for public housing protested in Constantine.

column9: RCD: Rally for Culture and Democracy Party
column17: RCD supporters were assaulted by police and reportedly injured in Tizi Ouzou.
A road north of Chlef was blocked by a group of demonstrators from the town of Chettia, who called the authorities to intervene in order to repair the road.
Students organised a protest sit-in outside the local administration of Oran. They demanded clarification concerning their professional status.
New protests were reported in Bejaia, as residents staged a sit-in outside the local administration offices.
Two groups of students coming from different villages clashed in the university of Khenchela. Police had to intervene to disperse the crowds.
Army detachment killed Sunday a militant in an ambush in Oued Essafsaf in Jijel, recovering his Kalashnikov submachine gun.

Algerian counter-terrorism forces on Wednesday killed an armed militant and arrested another in Constantine province. This operation was conducted by a joint security unit composed of army and police elements, as they intercepted the two militants in the locality of El Khroub. One, named Halfaoui, was captured alive; and the other, M. Youcef alias Zoubeir, blew himself up after being surrounded by the security forces. Zoubeir was suspected of having attempted to commit a suicide attack. The two were on the wanted list of the security forces, as detectives believe that they participated in the assassination of a police officer in downtown Constantine last October.

Disenfranchised young Sahrawis in the Tindouf camps took to the Polisario's TV headquarters last Thursday (April 20) and totally ransacked the premises, according to testimonies from the Rabouni camp, which houses the separatist front's headquarters. The angry Sahrawi youths spared neither transmission equipment, control rooms, nor power cables.

column7: SNCCOPEN: National Union of Common Bodies and Professional Workers in Public Education
column17: Police arrested demonstrators and members of the SNCCOPEN union in Mascara.
Residents of Hai Sabaah neighbourhood of Oran picketed to demand the creation of green areas.
Unknown assailants abducted a child in Ait Zmenzer commune, Tizi Ouzou wilaya. He was freed four days later.
Hundreds of workers staged a protest sit-in in Bejaia demanding the implementation of several industrial projects.
Three individuals on hunting trip were killed in IED/mine blast in the heights of Amrouna, Ain Defla Province
Three hikers died when a bomb exploded in the city of Ain Defla in the north of Algeria.

Algerian counter-terrorism troops on Saturday killed four armed militants in the southeastern province of Batna. The source specified that army troops launched a wide scale combing operation in the woods of Djbel Metlili, southern Batna. The operation led to the killing of four militants while four Kalachnikov sub machine-guns and ammunition were retrieved.

Families of detained activists staged a sit-in in front of the Tahar Djaou media headquarters in Algiers, calling for their liberation. The activists have been detained for 21 months in M'zab valley. Police intervened to disperse the protesters.

Tens of thousands of workers led by their syndicates staged a protest march on the occasion of 1st of May celebrations in Bejaia, calling for unity in the defence of syndicate liberties and workers' social rights.
Around a hundred people gathered in Oran to call for better purchasing power and defend employment and syndicate rights.
IED attack claimed by AQIM cell called El-Feth El-Moubine in the Ferkane area of Tebessa province destroying a military vehicle carrying army officers. No mentioned fatality.
Postal Workers protested last Tuesday in Sidi Aich to show solidarity with their comrade Acheuk Farid who was fired recently.

Dozens of youth set up road blocks on roads leading to voting centres in Raffour and threw rocks at offices of the local military police to prevent people from voting in the national legislative elections. The action started the day before the elections, and continued on election day. They clashed with members of the military police on several occasions during the riot. At least 3 were arrested.

column7: MSP: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Clashes between MSP and FLN supporters ahead of the national legislative elections in Robbah left at least four injured.

Dozens of youth set up road blocks on roads leading to voting centres in Haizer to prevent people from voting in the national legislative elections. The action started the day before the elections, and continued on election day.

Dozens of youth set up road blocks on roads leading to voting centres in Taghzout to prevent people from voting in the national legislative elections. The action started the day before the elections, and continued on election day.
An MEN supporter reportedly beat a PST supporter during national legislative elections in Adekar of Bejaia province.
Clash between youth and riot police in Afir, Boumerdes province in the context of national legislative elections left three people injured.
Rioters vandalised property at a voting centre in Ighrem locality, Ahnif commune of Bouira, on the day of national legislative elections. Road access on main roads was prevented as a result.
Rioters vandalised property at a voting centre in Ath Vouali of Bouira province in the context of national legislative elections.
Clash between RND and FLN supporters in Beni Thour in Ouargla province in the context of national legislative elections.

column9: MSP: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Clash between MPA and MSP/FC supporters at Echouf neighbourhood of Berriane in Ghardaia province in the context of national legislative elections. Police intervened to separate them.
Rioters vandalised property at a voting centre in Draa El khemis village of Bouira province in the context of national legislative elections.

column9: MSP: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Clash between MPA and MSP/FC supporters at Daia Ben Dahoua, Ghardaia province in the context of national legislative elections.
Clashes between FLN and RND supporters at voting centres in Sidi Bel Abbes, Touaita, and Sehala communes in the context of national legislative elections
Clash between RND and FLN supporters in Mekhadma in Biskra province in the context of national legislative elections.
Clashes between FLN and RND supporters at voting centres in Sidi Bel Abbes, Touaita, and Sehala communes in the context of national legislative elections
Clashes between FLN and RND supporters at voting centres in Sidi Bel Abbes, Touaita, and Sehala communes in the context of national legislative elections
Protests against national legislative elections in El Adjiba locality of Bouira.

Dozens of youth set up road blocks on roads leading to voting centres in Haizer to prevent people from voting in the national legislative elections. The action started the day before the elections, and continued on election day.

Dozens of youth set up road blocks on roads leading to voting centres in Taghzout to prevent people from voting in the national legislative elections. The action started the day before the elections, and continued on election day.
Rioters vandalised a voting centre in Mchedallah locality of Bouira on the day of the national legislative elections.

Dozens of youth set up road blocks on roads leading to voting centres in Raffour and threw rocks at offices of the local military police to prevent people from voting in the national legislative elections. The action started the day before the elections, and continued on election day. They clashed with members of the military police on several occasions during the riot. At least 3 were arrested.
Around 20 youth vandalised two voting centres in Saharidj commune, east of Bouira, and sent away people who had come to vote in the legislative elections.
Algerian soldiers killed a militant and seized weapons in the area of Djebel Seddat of Jijel province.
Retired soldiers organized a sit-in at Abbas Laghrour-square to demand an improvement of their socio-economic situation.
Around 200 retired soldiers held a short sit-in in Setif to call for better pension and loan rights, and for the recognition of martyrs.
Retired soldiers demonstrated in Relizane to demand an improvement of their socio-economic situation.
Entrepeneurs from all around the country gathered in front of the seat of the Ministre of habitation, urbanism and city to demand that open invoices be paid.
Inhabitants of Setif participated in the ""marche de la fidelite"" to commemorate the 70 birthday of the ""marche du sang"" on 8 Mai 1945.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: Military Forces of Algeria (1999-) Special Forces
column17: AQIM claimed the killing of 3 militaries of an ANP elite unit amidst clashes in the Mekournou mountains of Ain Defla. They refer to the mountainous area ranging from Zoubiria, Ouled Antar in Medea towards Birbouche in Ain Defla
Dozens of Infitah-party and Toufik Benyahkem supporters went to the streets to protest the disqualification of their candidate.
Protesters in Ouenza formed a human-chain and prevented workers to enter the local representation. They are demanding proper housing.
A militant, his nickname 'Abou Dher', was killed by the Algerian army in El Milia.
Number of armed militants killed amidst military operation in Ain Defla elevated to six with 6 AKs seized.

Independent teachers' unions protested in front of the Ministry of Labour although the education branch of the state-sponsored Union of Algerian Workers distanced itself from sporadic protests by teaching staff. On the same day, the headmasters of secondary schools also protested against new hiring policies in front of local education authority offices in several provinces.
Forestry workers from 20 eastern Algerian provinces protested in Batna to demand the right to carry arms in order to face poachers, according to El-Khabar.
After 2 women doctors were harassed in Boufarik hospital, the medial and paramedical personnel decided to protest this harassment.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

column7: UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: The National Commission for the coordination of orientation civil servants and guidance scholars, affiliated to the National Union of Education and Training Employees (UNPEF) demonstrated in front of the regional seat of the education directorate in Mostaganem. They denounce the systematic marginalisation of the advisory roles in the professional school system.
Retired personnel from the Algerian army (ANP) demonstrated to ask for an improvement of their socio-economic conditions.
Retired personnel from the Algerian army (ANP) demonstrated to ask for an improvement of their socio-economic conditions.
Retired personnel from the Algerian army (ANP) demonstrated to ask for an improvement of their socio-economic conditions.
Retired personnel from the Algerian army (ANP) demonstrated to ask for an improvement of their socio-economic conditions.
Retired personnel from the Algerian army (ANP) demonstrated to ask for an improvement of their socio-economic conditions.

column7: UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: Scholary advisors for the school system protested yesterday in front of the regional representation of the education directorate against their ongoing marginalisation. On the same day, workers of the Society for the distribution of electricity and gas of the center (SDC) struck to demand respect for syndicate liberties. They also demonstrated in front of the regional headquarters of the company.
Retired personnel from the Algerian army (ANP) demonstrated to ask for an improvement of their socio-economic conditions.

Workers at ""Illas' company, which operates under an American oil exploration company in Ohant district, protested by closing the company's door to urge the company to meet their demands. Workers are demanding to be included in the social security, especially as they are exposed to several risks as a result of their work in oil exploration, they also demand the company to reduce their working hours because they work 10 hours a day, in addition to increase wages.
ANP killed an armed militant and seized an AK & ammo yesterday amidst ambush on the outskirts of Collo, Skikda Province
Protests took place in Ouled Hadadj. The protesters intended to march towards Boumerdes to support the protesters there. Police prevented this by securing train stations and major roads.
Demonstrations from retired personal from the military escalated as police shot teargas into the crowds. The protesters answered with throwing stones onto the police. Several protesters were injured.

A cancellation the results of a recruitment competition made react yesterday the 18 winners of this contest. In a rally held yesterday in front of the Civil Service headquarters in Sidi El Hasni, the protesters, who were supported by the USTO workers' union, demanded clarification.
One militant was killed by the army.

Protesters protested in front of the local governmental offices. A list of beneficaries of social housing was published overnight and led the inhabitants to protest. A sit-in took place as well after the crowd chanted in anger. The protests soon turned violent and became riots, with the rioters destroying equipment inside the offices. Police had to intervene to disperse the rioters. One policeman was injured in the happenings.
The support committee for workers at Cevital-company organized a sit-in yesterday in front of the local radio station that received the director of the port in Bejaia.
ISIS claims an assault on a Gendarmerie checkpoint in Larbaa in which 4 gendarmes were wounded.

Workers of ""Nafthal"" institution organized a protest movement to demand the departure of Director General Hussein Rizo, over alleged poor management of institution and ""disregard"" of employees and recruitment of new staff members that are not efficient.
Pupils from the Ibn Khaldoun scholary group in Souk Ahras threw eggs at the administrative personnel. No injuries were reported.
Dozens of persons protested yesterday in front of the seat of the audiovisual regulatory body to denounce certain programs of private TV stations.

A crowd of demonstrators, shipowners and fishermen, invaded the port of Bouzedjar to denounce the ""non-management"" of the port infrastructure and the inconveniences that result for them. The coast guard who was also there, are accused of abuse of power and inappropriate remarks. However, no clashes between protesters and coast guard took place.
2 militaries from a gendarmerie patrol killed & 4 wounded in IED/mine blast in Ain Mdila. The El Feth Brigade (allied with AQIM) claimed responsibility
2 militaries from a gendarmerie patrol killed & 4 wounded in IED/mine blast on the outskirts of Ferkane, Tebessa Province.
Lawyers from Chlef organized a sit-in in front of the local court in Chlef to denounce infringements against their work by governmental authorities.

Young people from Sibaret blocked the road with barricades and prevented cars from continuing their way. They demand more water supply in their area, as they are currently served water only every 15 days.
Angry pupils threw stones at supervisors and teachers during an exam because they did not allow them to cheat. No injuries were reported.

Civil society activists, journalists, artits and intellectuals organized a sit-in in solidarity with Sahraouis that are under arrested in Morocco, especially with Gdeim Izik, whose process continue on the same day.
Employees of the APC struck and waged a sit-in in front of the local headquarters. They denounced the non-payment of 3 days on which the struck earlier.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: Cnapeste education syndicate held a protest in front of the education office.

column7: UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: UNPEF education syndicate held a protest in front of the education office.
Retired personnel from the military rioted in Setif in front of the local representation of the government, leading to an alleged clash with security forces.
Inhabitants of Skikda went to the streets to protest the cutting down of trees that adorn the urban space.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
Algerian counterterrorism troops on Thursday killed two armed militants in the southernmost province of Tamenrasset, near the border with Mali, said Algerian Defense Ministry in a statement.
During a military raid an IED detonated in Tipaza. No mentioned casualty.
AQIM claimed destroying an ANP vehicle & killing the occupants by IED detonation between Seiar & Chechar, #Khenchela on June 17. The attack was claimed specifically by ""Katibat El Feth El Moubine"".
Inhabitants of Ain Djerboua rioted to demand the improvement of urban infrastructure, especially sanitation and drinking water. The rioters blocked the road with burning tires.

About 20 housekeepers last Monday protested in Idjeur, a community belonging to the daira of Bouzeguene, some sixty kilometers east of Tizi Ouzou. These women, many of whom have already received the termination of their employment contract with the CPA, have come to protest against their abusive ""dismissal"" and claim their integration for decent wages and retirement.

Private operators who collect the household waste protested and invaded the town hall of Oran. Nearly 150 operators are concerned by the payment of debts, the advanced amount of which is around 700 million dinars.
Dozen of butchers gather in front of the seat of the commune to protest against the closure of the communal slaughterhouse and the opening of a new private one.

Inhabitants of the village of Mansourah in Ait Zikki commune in the daira of Bouzeguene protested to denounce the failure to respect the commitments of the local authorities who had promised to relaunch the development projects currently frozen.Early in the morning, the villagers blocked the front door of the APC headquarters. The elected officials and the employees who wanted to join their respective offices could not to do so because of the rioters.

More than 200 miners protested at the Ouenza mine in Tebessa, calling for better socio-professional conditions. Nine workers began a hunger strike two days later after having been dismissed following the protest.
Inhabitants of Adekar organized a sit-in in front of the regional governmental representation to call for the continuation of a development project.
Police dispersed a protest by inhabitants of a neighbourhood in Mascara that demanded proper housing. Protesters did not damage anything and no protester was injured during the arrests.
Beach Oued Romane in Mostaganem faced an act of vandalism. More than a dozen street lamps, as well as public fountains recently installed, have been vandalized by unknown persons.

The residents of the suburb Boukhors, on the outskirts of the city of Saida, expressed their anger, disrupting traffic with blocks of stone and used tires at the entrance to their neighborhood. They claim to receive decent housing.

Algerian entrepreneurs organized this Sunday a sit-in in front of the Algerian Realization and Construction Center (ALRECC) under the Ministry of Housing. The enterpreneurs who have built infrastructure for the State by subcontracting markets are demanding the settlement of unpaid invoices spread between 2011 and 2016 by a cumulative amount of 3.8 billion dinars.

More than 40 contractors with Algeria Telecom (AT) Constantine protested in front of the headquarters of the regional management of this company located on the road to the city Boussouf, to express their anger and claim payment of their Financial situations that have been dragging on for months.

Algerian entrepreneurs continued a sit-in in front of the Algerian Realization and Construction Center (ALRECC) under the Ministry of Housing. The enterpreneurs who have built infrastructure for the State by subcontracting markets are demanding the settlement of unpaid invoices spread between 2011 and 2016 by a cumulative amount of 3.8 billion dinars.
Protesters demand an improvement of their live conditions. They closed access to the seat of the regional representation through encircling it.
In Oued R'hiou, Ammi Moussa and Djidiouia, dozens of applicants for social housing have organized sit-ins to lobby local authorities.
Purchasers of housing units in Ain Melha in Alger's Djasr Kasentina commune gathered yesterday at the construction site to protest against a delay in the delivery of their apartments.
In Oued R'hiou, Ammi Moussa and Djidiouia, dozens of applicants for social housing have organized sit-ins to lobby local authorities.
In Oued R'hiou, Ammi Moussa and Djidiouia, dozens of applicants for social housing have organized sit-ins to lobby local authorities.
People profiting from the support of the state in getting housing units in Constantine gathered to protest against the delay in the delivery of their units.

Hundreds of the postal, technology and digital sector unions protested at the Algiers Telecom headquarters in Mohamadiya, demanding the settlement of the workers' rights and the departure of Federal President Mohamed Chulak and their support for what they called ""reforms"" of Minister Huda Iman Faroun.

The villagers of Barkata protested last Sunday in front the headquarters of the local representation of the Lakhdaria commune. They demanded from local officials urgent solutions to improve their living conditions.

The administrators of the university Salah Boubnider (Constantine) have been on strike since Sunday. They protested in front of the headquarters of the rectorate, to claim compliance with university regulations.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel
column17: Following a call by the National Autonomous Union of Public Administration Staff (Snapap) and the workers of the Directorate of Youth and Sports (DJS) the locality of Bouira protested last Monday. They demand the payment of outstanding salaries etc

The administrators of the university Salah Boubnider (Constantine) have been on strike since Sunday. They protested in front of the headquarters of the rectorate, to claim compliance with university regulations.
3 Tunisian terrorists fled across the border into Algeria near the Bouderias border. 3km from the border they were caught in gunfire with Algerian military forces and killed.

On Thursday, citizens of the Sidi Djilali neighborhood in Sidi Bel Abbes organized a sit-in at the level of a huge vacant lot, demanding the full truth about the underlying assumptions of real estate developers .

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
Dozens of people held a march to protest the state doctors' treatment of a local engineer with a liver infection.
former national servicemen staged a protest in Blida to express social demands.
Former national servicemen staged a protest in Bouira to express social demands.
When a youth was injured by a policeman dozens of people gathered to protest against the police, blockading the road with burning tires and other combustible objects.
The military ambushed and killed a militant in Sidi Yahia.
The employees of Sonelgaz held a march to call for labour reforms. At least 40 people were arrested.
Residents of El Match slum, in Skikda, rioted. The police suppressed the riots by firing teargas. 16 people, including 13 policemen were injured. 16 youths were arrested.
After Friday prayers, youths in El Match attempted to resume the protests from the previous day, but were suppressed by the police.
Riots broke out in Aokas when police tried to suppress a march against repression. The youths threw stones and the police responded with teargas.
Around 100 people staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the province in Sidi Bel Abbes to demand the dislocation of a real-estate project.
The Algerian military killed 2 armed Islamists in a confrontation in Tipaza. They also seized arms and ammunition.
Hearing of impending demolitions in their neighbourhood, citizens of Cite des Muriers, in Oued Zenati, protested outside the municipal offices.

Amor shepherds ordered Echorfa shepherds to remove their animals, prompting a violent confrontation between the two groups. More people from each group flocked to join the confrontation, using clubs and stones. 8 people were injured.
Hundreds of people marched in Aokas, to demand an end to government control over culture and to demand freedom of expression.
People from Chlef protested in front of the seat of the prefecture. They were protesting to complain about the delay of the government to provide social housing.
Activists and civil society organisations held a peaceful protest in Oran in solidarity with the activists protesting for freedom of expression in Aokas.

Inhabitants of Hai Zaboudja in the commune of Sidi Khaled gathered in front of the seat of the commune to demand once again regular water supply. The inhabitants suffered from constant water cuts during the last few months.
Citizens of Tala Tegaza in Freha forcefully shut down the local representation to protest against water cuts.
Citizens of Taghzout forcefully shut down the local representation to protest against water cuts. Services of the city hall could not be provided for some days due to the protesters actions.
Algerian army troops on Monday killed six armed militants in an ongoing counterterrorism operation in Safsafa, Gouraza, the upper woods of Tipaza province, 60 km western the capital city of Algiers.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM/Malahem claims IED detonation on army unit in Chlaalaa, Batna Prov. this morning, says killed 2 incl. an explosives expert.
Inhabitants of Relizane protested in front of the seat of the local government to demand housing.
Communal workers blocked the seat of the town hall through protesting. They refuse the list of housing-allocations drawn up for them by the Municipal Assembly and request a new list.

Citizens of the commune of Chechar, 50 km from Khenchela, tried yesterday to peacefully occupy the road leading to their commune due to the arrival of the new governor. They were hoping to be heard on their social concerns. The procession was able to continue on its way, without stopping, to go to the commune of Djellal.

200 workers from the Econeg-company from Skikda went to the streets to protest against the non-payment of their salaries. They marched towards the seat of the governor where they encountered him and talked about their complaints.
Citizens of Bouzeguene shut down the local representation to protest against water cuts.
Inhabitants of Issers protested in front of the seat of the prefecture to protest against the stop of infrastructure that was in the process of being built.
Retreated personnel from the army waged a sit-in in Mascara to demand from the government the fullfilment of its promises to improve the social and economical conditions of them.
The death of a women in Ain and Sara hospital led to protests in nearbay Hassi Basbah hospital, where health practitioners resigned in masses after being subjected to arrests.

Protests and mass resignations among health workers at Ain and Sara hospital in El Ouzraia who demanded the release their colleagues arrested over the death of a woman in Ain and Sara hospital. The doctors were accused of denying treatment to the woman ,which led to her death.
Facing cuts in in tap water, inhabitants of different villages in the prefecture of M'Chedellah protested in front of the seat of the prefecture and thereby closed its entry.

column7: MSP: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Inhabitants of Mascara protested against the recent US decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital. The protest was organised by the MSP.
Inhabitants of Tiaret protested in front of the seat of the local government to demand housing.
Inhabitants of Oued El Maleh closed the RN106 road linking Bordj to six communes in the north of the wilaya, as well as to the wilaya of Bejaia, to call for improved water and gas supply networks.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
Militant killed in Ouled Sidi Mahdi near Lakhdaria, Bouira Province.
Social security beneficiaries in Aghbalou locked the seat of the prefecture to protest against the decision of the government to freeze funds that should have been transferred to the commune.

Dozens of workers of the Algerian-Turkish company in Ain Yagout (40 km north of the city of Batna) held a sit Wednesday -in front of the company headquarters to protest against abuses and overtaxing. Many of them speak of abusive dismissal, reduction of salary, non-recognition of overtime, etc...
Social security beneficiaries in Aghbalou locked the seat of the prefecture to protest against the decision of the government to freeze funds that should have been transferred to the commune.

The railway traffic in the capital stopped after a sudden protest movement by its workers, which lasted nearly two hours to demand security in the trains, following an attack on a colleague inside a train in Beir Tuta.
Social security beneficiaries in Aghbalou locked the seat of the prefecture to protest against the decision of the government to freeze funds that should have been transferred to the commune.
Merchants from Oran staged a sit-in to complain about the proliferation of informal goods and the black market.
People from Souk Ahras protested in front of the seat of the prefecture. They were protesting to complain about the delay of the government to provide social housing.
Social security beneficiaries in Aghbalou locked the seat of the prefecture to protest against the decision of the government to freeze funds that should have been transferred to the commune.
People came together in Algiers to stage a sit-in to show their solidarity with ""La Tribune""-newspaper that has stopped publishing since August 10 due to a decision by shareholders.
Social security beneficiaries in Aghbalou locked the seat of the prefecture to protest against the decision of the government to freeze funds that should have been transferred to the commune.
Inhabitants of Ouled Slimane (Msila) protested against a documentary film, that fueled prejudices about their village.

Taxi drivers from Skikda organized a sit-in front of the representation of the transport authorities in the province. They had begun a strike the day before against low tarrifs imposed on them by authorities.

People from Tiaret staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the district. They were protesting because they could not find their names on the recently published list of beneficiaries of social housing.
Two gangs fought a bloody battle with knives and other objects. Security of the prefecture of Ain El-Turck had to intervene to stop the battle. Several people were injured.
Dozens of inhabitants from Akbou went to the streets to protest against the increasing pollution in the city.
The Algerian army killed a militant in Ain Defla. It is not clear to which group the militant belonged.

A suicide bomber killed two Algerian policemen on Thursday, including one who threw himself on the attacker whose explosives belt then detonated. ISIS and al-Qaida both claimed the attack, with al-Qaida accusing the ISIS of wrongly claiming the attack.

column7: CNFD: National Coordination of the Families of the Missing
column17: The National Coordination of the Families of the Missing (CNFD) held a protest rally on Boulevard Colonel Bougara, near the headquarters of the National Human Rights Council (CNDH), thus loudly marking the International Day of the Disappeared, which was celebrated the day before 30 August. Police Forces harassed the protesters and arrested several in front of the CNDH residence. Protesters shouteed anti-police slogans.

Farmers from Gamaa and Dra-Rmel, in the commune of Doucen blocked the road that connects Doucen with Lioua with huge stones and palm branches. They are demanding a secure electricity supply to their region as current irregularities in provision lead to constant difficulties in tilling the fields.

Movement of forces: Algerian authorities have sent additional reinforcements of up to 3,000 troops to the border areas near Libya, following a new security plan to prevent the possibility of infiltration by ""extremists"".
Beneficiaries from social housing protested to demand the continuation of constructing proper housing.
Inhabitants of Issers marched in their village to protest against the increasing lawlessness and insecurity affecting their village.

Inhabitants from Nesmen shut down the local representation in Taghzout, in the Bouira province, to invoke the equal sharing of water resources. The inhabitants were facing a dire situation, not having access to tap water for more than 3 months.

In Medrissa, teachers observed a sit-in of two hours in protest against the absence of a director in this establishment who experienced organizational disturbances that they impute in part to the former director transferred elsewhere.

To denounce the delay of public authorities in responding to their demands, the communal guards staged sit-in in front of the headquarters of the wilaya of Bejaia. They demand an improvement in their socio-economic- and working conditions.

The residents of Hai Meddah, a village in the commune of Sidi Chahmi, held a protest rally at the planned hospital's roundabout to denounce the delay in launching the land regularization plan for this site as promised by the former governor in December 2016.
Dozens of beneficiaries of social housing besiged the local representation of the government in Ain Temouchent, protesting against social housing lists on which they could not find their names.
Dozens of parents from school children protested in front of the regional seat of the region in Bouira against the authorities disregard of their demands to improve conditions for their children.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: The 'Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers' organized a sit-in in front of the local seat of the education directorate in Relizane. They protested, amongst others, against the their sidelining in meetings to solve professional and socio-economic problems of employees.
Doctors from the Infectious Diseases Department in the CHU hospital in Constantine held a protest throughout yesterday morning to denounce the deplorable conditions they have been in for months.
Dozens of beneficiaries of social housing besiged the local representation of the government in Ain Temouchent, protesting against social housing lists on which they could not find their names.

Social housing beneficiaries forcefully entered the local seat of the administrative region and then protested against social housing lists that were published the day before. Police in place could not prevent them from entering.

The evacuation of some families that were living in improvised homes near a gas pipeline in Barais led to altercations between the inhabitants and national gendarmerie. According to inhabitants, one girl died due to teargas used by the gendarmerie. Several injuries were reported as well. Officials deny the death of the girl.

Social housing (LSL) recipients of pre-assignment certificates, observed a sit-in in front of the offices in Souk Ahras to invoke the assignment of their allocations, that have been delayed for several months.
Inhabitants in Blida region blocked a road with tree branches to protest against the delay in opening a school.
Beneficiaries from a social housing program staged a sit-in in front of the 'National Company for Real Estate Promotion' in Oran. They protested against elevated housing costs.
Inhabitants from Tasga Melloul prevented employees from the National Water Company in Ain el Hammam to enter the premises. They protest against not having access to water for more than 20 days.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
Inhabitants from Ain El Beida staged a sit-in front of a newly built school that did not yet open its gates. The inhabitants demand authorities to open the school as soon as possible.
Dozens of subscribers to social housing programs in Ali Mendjeli protested yesterday in front of the office of the governor to denounce the delay in the completion of the housing units.
Women from Sidi Abdellah in Mahelma commune protested in front of the primary school to protest against poor public transport.
Teachers from a school in Ksar Chellal went on strike/protest against the nomination and missconduct of the new director of their school.

To denounce the delay of public authorities in responding to their demands, the communal guards staged sit-in in front of the headquarters of the wilaya of Bejaia. They demand an improvement in their socio-economic- and working conditions.
People protested in front of the seat of the National Algerian Water Company in Souk Ahras to denounce bad water supply in the city.
Pharmaceutical workers staged a sit-in in front of their working place to denounce the sacking of the director.

Dozens of residents of El Matmar, a locality just a few kilometers to the west of Relizane, protested in the city center to denounce the delayed initiation of criminal proceedings by police. It took the intervention of the local authorities to persuade the angry inhabitants to free the traffic that was interrupted for hours.

Social housing beneficiaries from El Mohgoun (Arzew) protested in front of the seat of the 'Caisse Nationale Du Logement' (CNL) in Gambetta to ask for a provision of housing units, complaining about waiting for more than 6 years already.

The residents of Hai Meddah, a village in the commune of Sidi Chahmi, held a protest rally at the planned hospital's roundabout to denounce the delay in launching the land regularization plan for this site as promised by the former governor in December 2016.
Inhabitants from 3 neighbourhoods in Skikda protested to shed light on their bad housing conditions.

About forty young people, mainly from Benboulaid city, at the entrance to the city of Arzew, blocked the railway line between Arzew and Oran in order to ask authorities to recruit them for the Societe national du transport ferroviaire (SNTF).

The mayor of Dechmia in Bouira-region was attacked with Molotov cocktails. The mayor was not hit by the projectiles. The national gendarmerie opened an investigation to determine the motive of this attack.

column7: UGCAA: General Union of Algerian Merchants and Artisans
column17: The milk vendors of the wilaya of Guelma decided to protest against a decision by the governor (on a proposal of the Trade Department) to shut the business of several of them.

column9: Military Forces of Algeria (1999-) Special Forces
column17: El Watan reported that 4 ANP soldiers incl. 1 SF officer were killed in IED blast overnight Sept 22-23 in Derrag, Ain Defla amidst ongoing operations in the area. A source close to DZ MOD/ANP refuted the El Watan report and others'.

The workers of the Urban and Sub-Urban Public Transportation in Ghardaia Municipality went on an open strike in front the headquarters of the Foundation, demanding the removal of the Director, due to his failure in running the company. They raised slogans demanding the end of arbitrary decisions.
Social housing beneficiaries from Ouled Djellal protested against the sudden stop in the construction of their housing units.

Dozens of citizens in N'sigha commune, a few kilometers south of the town of Khenchela, expressed their dissatisfaction with the delay in allocating 215 social housing units. The demonstrators blocked the section of a road, linking Khenchela to Biskra, for almost two hours, using stones and miscellaneous objects.
Social housing beneficiaries in Ouled Djellal protested to denounce the delay in the construction of housing units, indicating that they have been waiting for more than 14 years.
Algeria's National People's Army eliminated a militant in Tagrara, Merad municipality, province of Tipaza, some 80 km west of Algiers.

Medical workers staged a sit-in in front of the EHU hospital in Oran to denounce a negative media campaign that maligns their work. On the same day, civil protection employees from Oran staged a sit-in to demand the demission of the regional head of the civil protection units.
Dozens of inhabitants from Grarem-Gouga gathered in front of the seat of the governorate to protest against deteriorating living standards.

Beneficiaries of social housing (SPL) gathered in front of the General Directorate of the National Fund of Equalization of Social Works (FNPOS) to express their anger following the great delay in the provision of apartments.
Women who work in the Biskra public sector staged a sit-in at their workplace to denounce the deterioration of their working conditions.
Civil protection employees from Oran staged a sit-in to demand the resignation of the regional head of the civil protection units.
Dozens of social housing beneficiaries of Bendaoud gathered in front of the regional representation in Relizane to denounce the delay in the construction of housing units.

Several dozen residents of the Douar El Guemardia, located in the commune of Frenda, 57 km west of Tiaret, observed a peaceful sit-in to demand from the local authorities connection to the electrical grid.

Several dozen families and relatives of people who tried to migrate illegally blocked Thursday afternoon the fishing port La Grenouillere of Annaba. Many of them blocked the road to the port in order to oblige the naval forces to search their relatives, that got lost on the sea.
Presumed ISIS militant killed by ANP in El-Kseur, Bejaia.
Presumed ISIS/Katibat al-Fath militant killed & AK seized by the ANP in the area of Emir Abdelkader, Jijel Province.
Inhabitants of social housing protested to invoke access to gas supply and the electric grid for their homes.

Algerian counterterrorim troops on Sunday killed five armed militants in the locality of El Kseur, in the province of Bejaia. Army troops on Thursday had launched a wide scale dragging operation in the upper woods of El Kseur.

Police Forces arrested a 19-year old in Ain Beida and released him some hours later. The young guy declared that he suffered from torture and police brutality while being in detention. He was found dead in his bed the following day.
A primary school in Chaib, commune of Mekla, 20 km East of Tizi Ouzou was closed by parents of the pupils to denounce the delay in the construction of a new canteen.

The transporters of the urban lines of the city of Mila and the beneficiaries of the 50 social housing units of the municipality of Derrahi Bousselah protested yesterday in front of the local prefecture.
Workers from the Agence fonciere in Mostaganem protested to demand the demission of three members of the executive board.
Medical workers on strike protested in front of the CHU Hospital in Oran to denounce an increasing number of aggressions by patients who are coming to the hospital for treatment.

Citizens of Ain Beda went on the streets to protest against police-forces, accusing them of being responsible for the death of a 19-year old citizen. When facing police, protests turned violent, with rioters attacking police and police forces using teargas and bullets against the rioters. One rioter died and several were injured.

Several residents of the 'Cite Evolutive, located in the main town of Ath Laaziz, 10 km north of Bouira, shut down the local governmental representation to demand the widening of the road leading from their neighborhood to another neighbourhood.

column7: SNAPEST: National Union of Secondary and Technical Education Teachers
column17: Education personnel in Oran protested against irregularities in the latest A-levels exams and deteriorating working conditions.
A girl was kidnapped in Ain El Turk, Oran by unidentified individuals. Police managed to free te girl 3 days later.
Social housing beneficiaries protest against the delay in the provision of the promised housing units.
Social housing beneficiaries protest against the delay in the provision of the promised housing units.

Protesters in El Gammas, Constantine almost assault the local head executive during a protest over housing issues. Problems concern mainly housing because of the swift increase in the number of inhabitants. No actual violence reported.
Inhabitants from Berrahmoun in Corso staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the prefecture in Boumerdes to protest over housing problems.

Rail traffic witnessed delays as train drivers staged a sudden protest in the capital denouncing the company's administration's delay in implementing its agreement with the National Federation of Railway Workers. Demands include an increase in salaries.

Workers from Trans-Canal Ouest protested in front of the seat of the local district in Chaabat el Laham. Workers are concerned with the future of the company and the board of directors and their future salaries.

Parents from students in Sadaa, Sidi Okba blocked roads between El Haouche and Sidi Okba with branches and stones to protest against insufficient public transport for their children to commute to school.

Transport workers from Draa-Ben-Khedda region blocked the central crossroads in Draa Ben Khadda with buses to demonstrate against clandestine transport workers who are not being prosecuted by authorities.
Relizane. Inhabitants of a ""social housing city"" protested to demand a better living environment and infrastructure.
Six beneficiaries from social housing in Sidi Ali, Mostaganem, protested on a terasse to invoke the provision of their promised housing units. They also threatened to immolate themself.

Young inhabitants of Sidi Bakhti attacked Sonelgaz-company and ransacked machinery and equipment, burned a truck and attacked the electrical transformer that supplies the town. Rioters wanted to attack workers of the company as well but were stopped by gendarmerie. Rioters were angry because a truck from the company unloaded sand in front of the village's coffeehouse.

Parents from students in Tiferdoud closed the primary school to protest against the management of the school. Students and parental representatives stayed away from school to not engage in any form of dialogue. Police Forces were present in order to guarantee that no riots take place but no interaction between protesters and police took place.
The retirees of ""Gengaz"", affiliated to the National Company for Electricity and Gas, protested in Algiers because of the delay in paying a supplementary grant, promised to retirement workers.

column8: Military Forces of Algeria (1999-) Border Guards
column17: Over 40 Tunisian fishing boats have entered Algeria's territorial waters and carried out a ""symbolic protest"" over the detention of their colleague in the neighbouring country The boats, with around 120 fishermen on board, staged the protest to demand the immediate release of their colleague. The fisherman were arrested by the Algerian navy.
University teachers staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the local government in Oran to demand the swift completion of housing units that were promised to them some years ago.
Inhabitants from Chetma blocked roads with stones and burning tires to protest against the decreasing supply of tap water in the city.
Students in Mascara staged a sit-in at the entrance of Mustapha Stambouli university to denounce insufficient pedagogical services by the university.

Inhabitants of Ain Djerbouaie, Baba commune, 16km South of Khenchela blocked the road to garner attention of the governor who was touring the region. Inhabitants are complaining about the lack of development, jobs and water supply.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

150 workers from SNVI complex in Ain Bouchekif travelled to Algiers to protest in front of the HQs of the company against the increasing debts of the company. They fear being unemployed soon due to mismanagement by the board.
Workers from 'Trans-Canal Ouest' protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Ain Temouchent.
Private workers in the transport sector protested in order to denounce the advantageous treatment of public transport companies by the government.

Seven young people with knives invaded the CEM Maaroufi Salah in Sidi El Bashir neighbourhood in Oran, threatening teachers and students. Motives are unknown. No injuries or clashes were reported. The attackers fled soon after police was informed.
Inhabitants from Skikda staged a sit-in in front of the local housing agency to shed light on their bad housing conditions.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: Medical workers organized a protest in the hospitat in Beni Saf at the initiative of the SNMG and UGTA unions. With banners and posters they denounced the management-style of the director and demanded his departure.

Social Housing Beneficiaries encircled the seat of the prefecture to denounce the latest social housing lists. Police was present but no interaction took place. Different roads in the city were also blocked with burning tires and cars.
Workers from 'Epic Cacva-company protested in front of the UGTA-syndicate seat in Algiers to denounce the pressuring management-board of their company.

Inhabitants from Ouled Ali, N'Memcha and Seddara, from the commune of El-Hachimia south of Bouira blocked several streets that lead to quarries in the region, showing their insatisfaction with their deteriorating living standards caused by use of explosives in the quarries.

Related inhabitants from Ghat (Libya), Djanet (Algeria) and Elyse (Algeria), organized a protest on the Tin al-Koum border crossing between Ghat and Gent to demand the opening of the border to facilitate exchange. Algerian authorities had closed the border and deployed a number of their forces as a result of instability in Libya.
Algerian troops killed two armed militants and captured another one in a wide-scale operation in the area of Selma Ben Ziada, Jijel province.

Workers of a building site in Khenchela organized a sit-in in front of the south-Corean company managing the project to denounce the non-respect of agreements that were concluded between them and the company.
The seat of the local chapter of the 'Front des Forces Socialistes' in Yakouren was ravaged by unknown individuals.

Medical workers from the nephrology department in a hospital in Bouira protested in the hospital compound over the scarce availability of kindeys for their patients, denouncing a bad coordination among the hospital staff.
Algerian troops killed two armed militants in the area of Selma Ben Ziada, Jijel province.
Workers in Cheraga municipality protested in front of the seat of the municipality against the decision of the authorities to dismiss them.

Hundreds of employees and graduates of Al Takween Al Motawasel University in Msila protested, denouncing the refusal of the authorities to meet their demands, that is mainly related to the restoration of a preparatory phase, which was canceled earlier this year.
A 5th militant killed in Jijel this morning in operation that targeted a camp in Selma Ben Ziada, operation still ongoing.
Social housing beneficiaries protested in front of the seat of the prefecture in Hassi Rmel to denounce the delay in the provision of housing for them.
Social housing beneficiaries from Boukhalfa and Hazoura protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Tizi Ouzou to denounce the delay in the provision of housing for them.
Education counselors staged a sit-in in front of the directorate in Mila to demand an improvement in their professional situation through properly regulating their status.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: More than 300 workers from a metal-company staged a sit-in in front of the factory in the industrial zone Zaaroura in Tiaret to protest against their deteriorating socio-economic conditions.
A policeman from the mobile brigade of the judiary polices was attacked by three gunmen in Oued Dheb, Annaba. They exchanged shots before fleeing with their car. No injuries were reported.
Social Housing beneficiaries from Yellel, 20km east of Relizane, protested in front of the seat of the governorate to shed light on their bad housing conditions.

Hundreds of workers from Cevital factory organized a massive march towards Bejaia. The march ended with a protest rally during which the activists of the Cevital Workers Support Committee protested against austerity measures by the authorities.

Students from the English department at the University Mouloud Mammeri in Tizi Ouzou (Hasnaoua) staged a sit-in which blocked access to the directorate and administrative offices of their department to protest against the ignorance of the administration regarding sexual harassment cases.
Teaching personnel and workers from a college in El Euch, south of Bord Bou Arreridj, staged a sit-in inside the school. Protesters denounce surcharged school classes and missing didactic materiel.

More than 1000 former soldiers staged a protest in front of the local representation in Mila to denounce the injustice they are suffering from. They ask for a renumeration for several unpaid months of military service.

Dozens protested in front of the medical-pedagogical center for handicapped people during the visit of the governor of Relizane. They wanted to shed light on elevated housing prices that make their live difficult.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: Hundreds of workers, led by seven union executives, staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the general management of SNVI-company in Rouiba.
Workers of Education Directorate in Tizi Ouzou went on a strike for a full day and physically protested against the repeated attacks on staff and police working within the Directorate.

column8: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: Workers from SNVI-complex in Ain Bouchekif staged a sit-in in front of the local seat of the UGTA in Tiaret to denounce the decision by the syndicate to support the ex Secretary General of the company in his efforts to again become Secretary General of the company.
A electoral candidate of the FFS was physically agressed in his home in Tizgirt by unknown men.
The regional offices of the FFS in Ait Abdelmouemen were ravaged by unknown men.
Unknown men ravaged the regional offices of the RND-party in Mekla.
Teaching personnel and workers from a college in El Euch, south of Bord Bou Arreridj, protested in front of the school. Protesters denounce surcharged school classes and missing didactic materiel.
A candidate from Takatoul al-Fath Alliance for the municipal council elections in Khenchela was attacked by a man with a knife and heavily injured.
Inhabitants of Ghar Slim protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Mila to denounce a private-sector project near their village.

Parts of a building that was buying destroyed fell on a taxi and damaged the vehicle which angered public transport workers who interrupted work to denounce the authorities. This led to a short panic by passengers, followed by a gathering of several protesters which required the intervention of police forces to appease the angry protesters.
Two militants killed and arms seized yesterday afternoon in the area of Djebahia, Bouira Province.
Inhabitants from Adrar staged a sit-in to protest against the decision by authorities to transform a school into an educational center for teachers.
Parents of students from a primary school in Ras Bouira protested in front of the municipal council in Bouira against the closure of the school canteen.
The candidate of the 'Front el-Moustakbel'-list, Farouk Tireche, and supporters were attacked by a group of young guys armed with knifes and stones. 9 people were injured.
A policemen was seriously injured by a bullet. It is not known where the bullet came from.
Workers from 2SP-company protested against the dismissal of 7 colleagues.
Social housing beneficiaries organised a protest in front of the seat of the wilaya in Tizi Ouzou to demand a the swift completion of guaranteed social housing unitis.
Social housing beneficiaries organised a protest in front of the seat of the wilaya in Bouira to demand a swift completion of guaranteed social housing unitis.

column7: CLA: High Schools Council of Algeria; Teachers (Algeria)
column17: Teachers of the CLA protest outside the ministry of education in El Mouradia, but are 'repressed' by the police.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
The head of the prefecture of Cheira was injured by a candidate from the PLJ-party who suspects the head of privileging another party for municipal elections without remaining impartial.
Workers of the Sidi Bellabas plantation protested over the delay in payment of their wages for four months.
Al-Tassili's workers have been forced to protest because of the severe lack of safety conditions for passengers and the deteriorating working conditions for staff and pilots.
Unemployed youth sit-in to denounce their exclusion of the latest recruitment offers in the oil sector. The protesters were arrested by police.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: Teachers sit-in outside the Directorate of Education in Tizi Ouzou. The police roughly disperse the protesters.
The family member of a prominent disident member of the FNL dies in gendarmerie custody. The family accuses the police of carrying out an assassination. The claim is denied by the police
Clashes between political supporters (parties not named) in Batna.
FLN activists burned electoral material after accusing the RND of duplicating ballots in their offices.
Citizens of Haizer commune protest at the closing of the voting center in the city centre and the adding of 700 soldiers to the electoral roll.
Clashes between supporters of RND and FLN in Sehaila in Mascara wilaya
Following the announcement of the FLN's local electoral victory in Mostaganem, opposition activists (parties not named) burn the town hall. Some were arrested by the police.

column7: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Hundreds of citizens and activists protested in the city of Ouargla for two days to challenge the results of the local elections. Activists belonged to the opposition PNSD, HMS and Fajr Jadid. The protesters alleged electoral fraud by the ruling FLN.
RND protest against the FLN's electoral victory in Sidi Ben Adda and allege fraud.
Dozens of citizens gathered in front of the Oran Regional Theater to demonstrate against violence against women.

column7: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Hundreds of citizens and activists protested in the city of Ouargla for two days to challenge the results of the local elections. Activists belonged to the opposition PNSD, HMS and Fajr Jadid. The protesters alleged electoral fraud by the ruling FLN.

column7: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Opposition parties continue to protest against the FLN's victory in Ouargla. For two days party activists violently clashed with police.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: CNAPESTE launches a strike and protests outside the education directorate and accuse the government of destroying the education sector.

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Collective of Algerian Residents; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: Doctors and locals protest and demand to be exempt from military service. The protest was organised by Autonomous Collective of Algerian Resident Doctors (CAMRA)

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Collective of Algerian Residents; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: Doctors protest in Constantine and demand exemption from military service.

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Collective of Algerian Residents; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: Doctors protest in Oran. The protest is organised by CAMRA.

column7: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
column17: Opposition parties continue to protest against the FLN's victory in Ouargla. For two days party activists violently clashed with police.

column7: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: The National Office of the Higher Education Teachers Union decided to take part in a national protest in front of the headquarters of the University of Mascara against the Dean who filed a law suit against a professor who was a member of the union
Teachers at El Bachir El Ibrahimi University in Bordj Bou Arreridj held a sit-in at the Faculty of Science and Technology to denounce the firing of their colleague.
Young people demonstrated against the fact that they could not find their names on social housing beneficiaries lists.

column7: MSP: Movement of Society for Peace; PT: Workers Party; ANR: National Republican Alliance; FFS: Socialist Forces Front; MPA: Algerian Popular Movement
column17: Dozens of activists MSP, PT, FFS, MPA, ANR, and those of the alliance Nahda-Adala-Bina held a sit-in to denounce alleged fraud during the local elections on Nov 23. A large police detachment was deployed to prevent protesters from approaching the cabinet. And the rally was dispersed after 20 minutes in calm.
Students organized a commemoration march on the day when journalist Said Mekbel died 23 years ago.
A group of secondary school students took to the streets of Sidi Aich with banners condemning attacks against Tamazight.
Bakers from Tizi Ouzou region held a sit-in in front of the prefecture to protest against their difficulty to sell their bread at a set prize.
Medical workers protested to call for a reform of the civil service sector.
Hundreds of youth protested in Ain Beida against their rejection from the social housing beneficiaries list, hampering access to the town. They set up a tent and banners and stayed for several days.
Medical workers protested to call for a reform of the civil service sector.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: The 'Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers' staged a sit-in in front of the prefecture in Tizi Ouzou to call for a punishment of a policeman who attacked a teacher on October 18.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers
column17: The 'Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers' protested in Azazga to call for a punishment of a policeman who attacked a teacher on October 18.

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Medical Residents Collective; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: The autonomous collective of Algerian residential medical workers organized a protest in the hospital Mohamed Lamine Debaghine in Algiers. Several residents from Algiers, Blida and Tiziouou participated in the protest.
Amazigh students from the Abderrahmane Mira University marched in Bejaia against recent attacks against their language, paralysing two campus at the university.
Citizens organized a march in Didouche Mourad street to protest against the arrival of French president Macron in the country.
Dozens of merchants protested in Khenchela against a planned 'trade fair' which would impact their business.
Inhabitants of Aokas and Souk el Tenine organized a protest march for the protection of the woodland nearby from Aokas to Souk el Tenine.
Social housing beneficiaries protested in front of the municipality in Biskra to denounce their exclusion from a national programme supporting social housing beneficiaries.

column7: CNFD: National Coordination of the Families of the Missing
column17: Several family members of victims of forced disappearance protested in Constantine to call on authorities to determine the fate of the individuals.
Algerians protested in Constantine to denounce the US decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel's capital.
Protesters demonstrated in Mila to denounce Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Social housing beneficiaries from Oran protested against authorities' failure to relocate them to better apartments since 1974.
Protesters gathered in Biskra to denounce the recent US decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital and move it's embassy there.
Social housing beneficiaries from Diar el Hana, Tigditt, Mostaganem blocked the main road to denounce the delayed provision of promised new housing units.
Algerians protested in Bouira province to denounce the US decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Berbers protested in Aokas and El Kseur against the government's decision to allocate insufficient teaching funds to Amazigh schools, which they consider an attack on their language and culture.
Berbers protested in Aokas and El Kseur against the government's decision to allocate insufficient teaching funds to Amazigh schools, which they consider an attack on their language and culture.
Algerian police attacked 300 Zimbabwean students who were staging a sit-in outside the embassy to complain about a 15-month-delay in receiving their scholarships. One female student was hospitalised.
Protesters, most of them students, demonstrated in Ghardaia to denounce Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Hundreds of students protested against the marginalisation of the Berber language.

column17: Education personnel from the CNAPESTE staged a sit-in to call for an improvement of their working conditions.

Clash between Berber activists protesting the government's decision to allocate insufficient funds to Amazigh schools in Bouira over at least 12-13 December. They disagreed on the way to organise the protests and clashed with stones and batons.

Berber students in Draa Ben Kheda and Matkas protested against the government's decision to allocate insufficient teaching funds to Amazigh schools.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
Social housing beneficiaries staged a sit-in in Ain el Beida, Oran, to call on a swift provision of promised new housing units.
After the death of a motorcyclist, inhabitants from Cite Okba ibn Nafaa in Souk Ahras protested to denounce the bad traffic conditions in the city.
Social housing beneficiaries protested to denounce the delay in the completion of their promised housing units.

All educatory institutes in Bouira remain closed by a general strike.
During a protest, a civilian from Ain Temouchent immolated himself to protest against the fact that he has to wait too long for a social housing unit. He was seriously injured.

Medical workers protested in front of the general direction of the CHUO in Oran due to their difficult working conditions.

Workers from an Italian company in Ain Charchar, Skikda, protested to denounce bad conditions in working for the company.
Inhabitants from Bellil, Hassi Rmel, organized a protest march to call on authorities to put an end to the insecurity and lawlessness in the city.

SME-owners protested in Tizi Ouzou to call for a complete debt cut on their private debts.

Following the non-renewal of the contract of a doctor, who has been working for years at a public spa complex in Biskra, about 40 workers staged a sit-in to show their solidarity with him.

Inhabitants of Khechab in Ben Daoud, Relizane, protested in front of the seat of the governorate against the deterioriation of their living conditions.

Social housing applicants protested in front of the prefecture to call for a swift provision of promised housing units.
Angry families blocked the road to the port in Skikda to denounce a sickening smell of gas which reached their homes.

Students of the Agronomic Institute in Mostaganem and other students from the governorate protested in Mostaganem to call for a revision of the legal status of being a student.
Inhabitants of Souk Ahras protested because water supply to their city is currently cut.
Social housing beneficiaries in Tebessa staged a sit-in for 2 days to call for a swift provision of promised housing units.

Two militants killed and two AKs seized by the ANP this evening in the area of Ouled Hellal, Medea Province.

Social housing beneficiaries from Bormadia, Relizane, protested to denounce the delay in the provision of apartments.

On international women's day, a women association demonstrated in Bejaia to call for granting more rights to women.

Students voiced their objection against disciplinary measures that students on strike since November 2017 are subject to. They left the campus after police called upon them to do so.

Weapons Seizure: On 23 March, arms and ammunition cache discovered in the area of Bordj Badji Mokhtar near the Mali border. Cache contained a significant number (24) of rifles, medium and heavy machine guns, 48 mortar shells, 6 grenades, 1 RPG rocket and 3224 rounds of ammunition.
On 30 March, families protested in Constantine against the introduction of a payment system to enter the El Meridj park.
Around 30 March, families in Tindouf protested against abuses against Gold searchers by the Polisario Front. Polisario violently repressed the protests and stripped protesters of all their property.

On 31 March, football fans of JSMS rioted against club officials whom they accuse of mismanaging the club. They blocked streets and destroyed public property in Skikda before clashing with police forces. The result were at least 39 injured policemen.
On 31 March, inhabitants of Annaba took the streets of Annaba to protest against the enlargement of a medical clinic which would lead to infrastructure problems.
On 2 April, social housing beneficiaries staged a sit-in in Zouaghi, Constantine, to call for a swift provision of promised housing units.
Defusal: On 2 April, Algerian military forces destroyed four militant bunkers in Boumerdes and Batna. Moreover, 7 militants reportedly surrendered to Algerian forces.

On 2 April, Algerian military forces killed a militant in Boudoukha, west of Ain Kechra, Skikda province. Three days later on 5 April, they destroyed a militant hideout in Skikda containing 6 bombs. There was no report of fighting.
On 3 April, social housing applicants protested in Oued Rhio against not finding their names on lists of social housing beneficiaries.

On the week of 3 April, inhabitants from Bouzeguene staged a sit-in in front of the prefecture to call on the administration to devise a plan to supply the city with water during the next summer season.

column7: CNAPESTE: National Independent Council of Higher Education Teachers; UNPEF: National Union of Education and Training Employees; SNTE: National Union of Education Workers
column17: On 4 April, more than 100 workers from UNPEF, CNAPESTE and SNTE syndicates staged a protest in front of the seat of the governorate in Oran to denounce the governments responses to intersyndicalist (Snapest, Cnapeste, CLA, Saetf, Unpef, SNTE) demands.

column7: CAPS: Multi-purpose Agricultural Cooperative for Services
column17: On 4 April, workers from the CAPS staged a sit-in in front of the cooperative headquarters in Sidi Lakhdar to denounce the mismanagement by the directorate. They blocked the entry with a lock.

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Medical Residents Collective; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: On 4 April, CAMRA residenct doctors staged a small protest in front of a hospital in Algiers. The day before, CAMRA decided to continue its nationwide strike after the government failed to concede to the abolition of obligatory civil service.
Defusal: On 5 April, military forces destroyed a militant hideout in Skikda containing 6 bombs. There was no report of fighting.

column7: SNCCOPEN: National Union of Common Bodies and Professional Workers in Public Education
column17: On 7 April, workers from the SNCCOPEN protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Oran to call for an improvement of their socio-professional situation.

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Medical Residents Collective; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: On 8 April, CAMRA resident doctors boycotted the DEMS-exams through protesteing in EHU Oran and CHU Algiers.

column7: CAMRA: Autonomous Medical Residents Collective; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: On 8 April, CAMRA resident doctors boycotted the DEMS-exams through protesteing in EHU Oran and CHU Algiers.
On 8 April, social housing beneficiaries protested in front of the cabinet of the governor in Boussouf, Constantine, to denounce the bad equipment of their flats which they received 10 years ago.
On 9 April, social housing beneficiaries protested in Boumerdes because electricity and housing have been cut for more than a month.

On 10 April, workers of an Algerian water company (ADE) staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the company in Hammadi Krouma, South of Skikda, to denounce the deterioration of their socio-professional situation.

On 10 April, around 200 former soldiers organised a protest march at Zaamouche station of Bab el Kantara in Constantine to call for the provision of a proper pension. Police dispersed the protest and arrested four protesters without causing injuries.
On 10 April, social housing beneficiaries protested in Sidi Bel Abbes to call for the provision of housing units promised to them in 2013.

On 11 April, patients protested in front of the administration of the CHU hospital in Parnet, Algiers, against the stopping of consultation with CAMRA medical doctors and the lack of medical services.

On 11 April, students from the 'Ecole normale superieure' in Setif continued protests against the dismissal of colleagues and against a clause that abolishes direct employment by the state after finishing the ENS.

On 11 April, students from the 'Ecole normale superieure' in Skikda continued protests against the dismissal of colleagues and against a clause that abolishes direct employment by the state after finishing the ENS.

On 11 April, students from the 'Ecole normale superieure' in Assia Djebar, Constantine, continued protests against the dismissal of colleagues and against a clause that abolishes direct employment by the state after finishing the ENS.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Agreement: Between early April and end May, 22 militants surrendered to the state forces while 8 were arrested in Tamanrasset and Adrar. The surrenders have come as part of a recent deal concluded by Algeria and France, which includes a form of amnesty for militants who surrender.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan African migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.
On 16 April, rioters set the car of the prefecture in Ain Ben Beida, Guelma, on fire.
On 16 April, workers from Hassi Hameche protested in Hassi Mameche to call for a meeting wiht the mayor and demand the outstanding payment of three monthly salaries.

On 16 April, students staged a sit-in in Boumerdes to condemn an aggression by a guard in a student residence and to denounce the deterioration of the living conditions in the student residences in general.

Around 17 April, inhabitants from Ouled Chadli, Belgharib, Ouled Sidi Amara and Messaadia blocked the street in Ouled Sid Mihoub, Djidiouia daira, with tires and stones to protest against the deterioration of their socio-economic situation.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: On 17 April, library staff belonging to UGTA from the national library in El Hamma, Algiers, organised a protest to call for the appointment of a director for the library.
