On Nov 25, residents from the Tizi Ouzou wilaya staged a protest in front of the administrative HQs to denounce corruption in the AADL 2001 social housing programme. 17 years after the programme was launched, a number of apartments remain unallocated.
On 26 November, chemistry students of Akhli-Mohand Oulhadj university in Bouira protested to call for an improvement of their study conditions and started an open-ended strike.
On 26 November, social housing beneficiaries protested in front of the governor's home in Skikda because the real estate had stopped developping the promised units.

On Nov 26, a number of students and their parents from Ait Ighil village in the Agouni Gueghrane commune staged a protest in front of the local authority calling for a school transport system to be created. Today, children in primary school walk between 3-5 kilometers to school.

On Nov 26, dozens of residents from the Chelghoum Laid commune staged a protest in front of the wali's office in Mila to denounce the fact that their neighbourhood should be attached to the city's natural gas network.
On 26 November., inhabitants of Thenia protested to denounce the delay in the provision of social housing units.
On 26 November, inhabitants of Ouled Larbaa (Cap Djinet) called for development of the village because of deteriorating living conditions.

On Nov 27, around 190 people who had initially been chosen as beneficiaries of a social housing project but then removed from the 1,500-beneficiary list staged a protest in front of the daira of Hamma Bouziane to contest the latest decision.
On Nov 27, residents from the Guettar El Aich ghetto in Al Khroub gathered in front of the wali's office to ask for new housing projects as their ghetto is being ignored by the authorities.

On Nov 27, a number of Constantine residents coming from several areas of the city gathered in front of the daira of Constantine to contest the fact that they had been removed from a list of beneficiaries of a social housing project after being intially chosen.
On 27 November, farmers protested in front of the governor's seat in Bechar to call for the abolition of a 15-year old directive which prohibits to use border land as range land.

On Nov 27, dozens of people who had subscribed to a housing project in Siouane held a protest in front of the wali's office to denounce the estate agent's decision to halt the project for financial reasons.
On 28 November, Tamazigh students of Akhli-Mohand Oulhadj university in Bouira protested to call for an improvement of their study conditions and went on an open-ended stirke.
In the week of 28 November, inhabitants of Ouled Ben Salah housing units, 8km from Ammal, Bouira province shut down the prefecture for 3 days to call for increased government support.
In the week of 28 November, inhabitants of Ouled Brahim protested to call for better infrastructure.
In the week of 28 November, inhabitants of Ammal called for better development of social housing units.

In the week of November 28th, students continued to block entrance to the Targa Ouezmour and Abouadou campus of Bejaia University to denounce the expulsion of 34 students known to be politically active from the university. The students were said to have remained on strike between November 26 and December 2.
In the week of 28 November, social housing applicants blocked the road in Sidi Ghiles to call for the publication of the social housing beneficiaries lists.

On 28 November, students at the Tamda campus of the Mouloud-Mammeri university of Tizi Ouzou shut down the rectorate to denounce the bad conditions at the university. Students blocked the campus for more than two weeks. Events coded on 21 November 28 November and 3 December.
On Nov 28, residents from Bechloul staged a protest in front of the local clinic denouncing the degradation of the building and asking for a better health system.
Inhabitants of Sirat, Mostaganem, protested in front of the prefecture to denounce the shortage of water in the city over several days. Two protests coded on 28 and 30 November.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel; Labour Group (Algeria)
column17: On 29 November, protesters affiliated with the SNAPAP organised a protest to denounce the marginalisation of syndicates and the actions by authorities against the right to strike.
On 29 November, farmers protested in front of the prefecture in Hamadia against the delay in the demarcation of land which was given to them as part of an investment scheme in Rechaiga.

On Nov 29, the Algerian army claimed that 4 ""terrorists"" - Khalaoui Mouhi Souna, Herouini Ahmed, Bakhti Ali and Atik Naimi - surrendered to the military authorities in Djanet. Precise affiliation unclear.
On Nov 29, the Algerian army claimed to have destroyed 12 IEDs in a ""terrorist bunker"" in Ouled Antar in Medea. Precise affiliation unclear.
On Nov 29, the Algerian army claimed to have arrested 1 ""terrorist"" - Mazili Hama -, in addition to 1 individual providing ""terrorist support"", in Adrar. Precise affiliation unclear.
On 29 November, inhabitants of Zenina/Idrissiya protested in front of the Idrissiya court to call for the liberation of Rabih ibn Idrissiya whom they consider jailed unjustly.

A construction site in Zitoun neighbourhood in the center of Chlef has been blocked by protesters for twelve days. The protesters call for a resettlement to better social housing units. 3 protests coded on 29 November, 3 December and 7 December.

On Nov 29, dozens of young people took to the streets in central Algiers to show their anger after the death of several people trying to cross the Mediterranean and called out the authorities for their silence.
On 30 November, public transport workers in Ferdjioua protested to demand authorities to regulate traffic in the city.
On 30 November, a 15-year old girl was kidnapped in Taureaux, Oran. She has been found by police 5 days later in Ain El Turkc
Inhabitants of Sirat, Mostaganem, protested in front of the prefecture to denounce the shortage of water in the city over several days. Two protests coded on 28 and 30 November.
On 1 December, Tamazigh students of Akhli-Mohand Oulhadj university in Bouira protested to call for an improvement of their study conditions.
On 1 December, merchants in Batna blocked roads in the center of Batna with burning tires to denounce a decision by authorities to force-closure 100 shops in the city.
On 1 December, activists from the Amgud associated who wanted to organise a conference were denied to do so by local authorities and therefore protested in front of the cinema in Draa el Mizan.

On Dec 1, police forces were deployed in El Kettani and other neighbourhoods of Bab El Oued in Algiers to respond to a call to protest. The expected mass demonstration did not happen and police forces spent the whole day dispersing small groups of people.
On 2 December, social housing inhabitants of Djaballah 1 and 2 in the cite des Freres Abbes, also known as Oued el Had, protested to call for adequate alternative housing.
On 2 December, dozens of protesters shut down the prefecture to protest against the shortage of tap water in their houses.
On 2 December, rioters in Raffour blocked the RN15 road wih burning tires to call for the provision of natural gas to their social housing units.
On 2 December, inhabitants of Tidjelabine protested in front of the prefecture to persuade the mayor to not resign his post.
On 2 December, inhabitants of the Cite 2000 of the El-Bez cite in Stif blocked the tram in Setif to denounce the regrettable condition of the social housing units that they live in.
On 2 December, protesters in Tizi Ouzou organised a sit-in in support of the director of the house of culture who was removed from her post by the minister of culture.
On 2 December, protesters gathered in Draa el Mizan to call for a swift completion of promised social housing units.
On 2 December, activists and solidarity workers organised a protest in front of the regional ministry of health in Djelfa to set up a hospital with the aim to fight cancer.

On 2 December, Algerian citizens tried to demonstrate against the visit of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman but were prevented by massive deployments of security forces at the 1 May Square and the Grand Poste.
On 2 December, unemployed workers from the Algerian-chinese factory Daphine d'Or, closed for two months, protested and called for the reopening of the factory.
On 3 December, workers from Tonic company in Tipaza protested because of delay in payment of their monthly salaries.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel
column17: On 3 December, engineering teaching affiliated with SNAPAP started a 3-day-long sit-in in El Khroub to denounce their low salaries.
On 3 December, inhabitants of Sidi Harb in Annaba protested to call for the publication of social housing beneficiaries lists.

On 3 December, inhabitants of Bukahdra, in El Bouni district, organised a protest to call for the provision of adequate alternative social housing. Similarly, citizens also protested in the Wadi al-Nil and the Juma Huseyn neighbourhood of al Bouni.
On 3 December, inhabitants of Sidi Amar, Annaba, closed the road to call for the publication of social housing beneficiaries lists. Closing the road was reached through protesting physically.
On 3 December, inhabitants of Kemmouda, in Betrouna, Tizi Ouzou, closed the RN12 to call for the provision of natural gas to their village.

On 3 December, students at the Tamda campus of the Mouloud-Mammeri university of Tizi Ouzou shut down the rectorate to denounce the bad conditions at the university. Students have been on strike for two weeks.

A construction site in Zitoun neighbourhood in the center of Chlef has been blocked by protesters for twelve days. The protesters call for a resettlement to better social housing units. 3 protests coded on 29 November, 3 December and 7 December.

column7: SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel
column17: On 3 December, the SNAPAP syndicate protested in front of the finance directorate situated in Coudiat. They denounce worsening working conditions and governmental repression of syndicates.
In the week of 5 December, a 19-year old man has been kidnapped by a group of five due to a dispute between two families.

column7: Students (Algeria); UGEA: General Union of Algerian Students
column17: On 4 December, students of the UGEA (General Union of Algerian Students) protested in front of a faculty of University Constantine 1 to call for heating the university.
On 4 December, a 14-year old was kidnapped by two guys aged 29 and 35. The teenager was liberated by police 4 days later.
On 4 December, social housing beneficiaries protested in El Alia-Nord to demand authorities to fullfil their promises to provide them with new housing units.
On 4 December, around 50 people staged a sit-in in Ouargla in support of Khaled Zerrouki who was imprisoned during a protest on 15 September.
On 4 December, social housing beneficiaries protested in Stora to call for the provision of land for farming that authorities had promised.
On 4 December, inhabitants of Tidjelabine protested in front of the prefecture to persuade the mayor to not resign his post.

On 4 December, inhabitants of Iqemuden, south of Tizi Ouzou protested on the RN12 next to Bouhninoun to call for the provision of electricity and natural gas to their village. They blocked the road through being physically present.
On 4 December, fans from Mouloudia Oran staged a sit-in in Oran to call for the resignation of current president Belhadj Ahmed.
On 4 December, merchants from the ex-farmer souk in Ain el Turck in Oran protested in front of the prefecture in Oran to call for a legal regularisation of their activities.
On 5 December, the inhabitants of Debha in Amizour organised a protest in front of the prefecture to call for a clear ownership determination of land that they want to use for farming.

In the week of December 5th, students continued to block entrance to the Targa Ouezmour and Abouadou campus of Bejaia University to denounce the expulsion of 34 students known to be politically active from the university. The students were said to have remained on strike between November 27th to December 5th.

On 12 December, students from the fine arts university in Azazga have protested for more than a week to denounce the critical situation in the school and counterproductive actions, strikes and protests organised by the UGTA syndicate against the school. 3 protests coded on 5, 8 and 12 December.
On 5 December, a bureaucrat disappeared during service in Chlef. He was found with bruises two days later at a cemetery in Sidi Bel Abbes.

column7: Labour Group (Algeria); RCD: Rally for Culture and Democracy Party
column17: On 6 December, unemployed workers from the Algerian-chinese factory Daphine d'Or, closed for two months, protested again in Bechloul and called for the reopening of the factory. This time they were supported by the RCD group.
On 6 December, the Algerian army seized 11 air-to-surface missiles in a search operation in Bordj Badji Mokhtar. Other detachment destroyed home-made bombs and terrorists hideouts.
On 7 December, dozens of Berbers protested in Bousselam in solidarity with blogger Merzoug Touati who has been detained for more than two years.

A construction site in Zitoun neighbourhood in the center of Chlef has been blocked by protesters for twelve days. The protesters call for a resettlement to better social housing units. 3 protests coded on 29 November, 3 December and 7 December.

On 12 December, students from the fine arts university in Azazga have protested for more than a week to denounce the critical situation in the school and counterproductive actions, strikes and protests organised by the UGTA syndicate against the school. 3 protests coded on 5, 8 and 12 December.

Whereas the protests by students from faculty of economics, business and management at the Mouloud Mammeri campus in Tamda stopped, students from the human and social sciences faculty continue to protest and paralyse all administrative activities at the universtiy. Two protests coded on 8 December and 12 December.

On 9 December, students from the chemistry department in Bouira blocked entrance to different departments. They are on strike for more than a month to call for better equipment for laboratories and classrooms

On 9 December, over a thousand workers from the steel complex in Sider el Hadjar, Annaba, blocked the factory through preventing the transportation of cast iron to call for permanent contracts. They remained on strike as of December 13. Coded as two events on December 9th and 12th.

On 9 December, inhabitants of Sidi Ali (Tagdempt) blocked the road in Tagdempt with tires and other objects to call for the construction of a school in the village. Other inhabitants spoke to them and they soon stopped with the riots.
On 9 December, workers from the Skikda public transport enterprise (Sotski) protested in Hammadi Krouma to denounce being transferred to another public transport company (ALTRO).
On 9 December, dozens of inhabitants protested in front of the chirurgical facility in Sour el Ghozlane to call for it's reopning and for additional doctors.

On 9 December, social housing applicants from Mouldiouane, Draa Ben Khedda district, protest in front of the prefecture in Draa Ben Khedda to call for the construction of social housing units in their village.
On 9 December, the Algerian military claimed to have destroyed two hideouts and one homemade bomb of militants in Ain Defla.

On 9 December, inhabitants of Taghzout shut down the prefecture in the village to call for an improvement in their socio-economic conditions. They call for the restoration of the main road which leads to the village, access to tap water and connection to the gas network.

On 10 December, inhabitants of Kef el-Ahmar in Rogassa district in El Bayadh staged a sit-in on the 6A road, paralysing all transport from the village to El Bayadh to denounce plans to establish a waste disposal site near to the village.

On 10 December, students from the chemistry department in Bouira again blocked entrance to different departments. They are on strike for more than a month to call for better equipment for laboratories and classrooms.
On 10 December, social housing applicants protested in front of the prefecture in Constantine to call for the publication of social housing beneficiaries lists.
On 10 December, social housing applications from Ain Bessem protested in front of the prefecture to call for a swift publication of social housing beneficiaries lists.

On 10 December, activists in Bejaia rolled out banners in front of the hotel in which Chakib Khelil, former energy and mining minister, participated, to call for his departure from the city and the liberation of Merzoug Touati.
On 10 December, protesters staged a sit-in in front of the housing agency in Oran to call for more transparency in the electronic social housing system and in the allocation of housing units.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
column17: On 10 December, under police presence, UGTA protesters in front of the syndicates seat Algiers called for the resignation of the secretary general Sidi Said. As they arrived at they seat they came in contact with pro-Sidi Said protesters without any clashes.
On 10 December, social housing beneficiaries protested in front of the housing directorate in Bir el Djir to call for fixing the social housing website so they can pay their first fees.

On 10 December, merchants in Tipaza staged a sit-in on a road and blocked traffic to get local authorities to reconsider the traffic plan that was put into operation in September which causes them heavy losses.

column7: CNFD: National Coordination of the Families of the Missing
column17: On 10 December, families of individuals who were targeted by enforced disappearance protested in Algiers on the 70 birthday of the Universal declaration of human rights. Police dispersed the protest by arresting the demonstrators.

On 10 December, Algerian security forces dispersed a sit-in by retired soldiers in Khenchela. Several protesters were injured. The protesters wanted to show their support for other retired soldiers who were on process in Khenchela for illegally organising a protest in October 2018.
On 11 December, workers at the Construb-East site in Ain Smara staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the construction company in Palma, Ain Smara, to call for an improvement of working conditions.
On 11 December, sports teachers protested in front of the governor's seat in Msila to call for negotiations regarding the organisation of the school sports sector in the province.

column7: Health Workers (Algeria); SNPSP: National Union of Public Health Doctors
column17: On 11 December, health workers affiliated with the SNPSP syndicate staged a sit-in in front of the public health directorate to protest against aggressions in hospitals.

On 11 December, teenagers protested in front of the directorate of sport and youth in Bechar after learning that no single candidate from Bechar has been accepted to one of the three sports institutes in Algiers, Oran and Ouargla.
On 11 December, young people briefly blocked the convoy of the governor of Tizi Ouzou in Ait Yahia Moussa to call for the provision of natural gas to the village.
On 11 December, social housing applicants protested in front of the governorate's seat in Biskra to call for the swift completion of promised social housing units.
On 11 December, social housing inhabitants shut down the prefecture in Draa Ben Khedda to call for a swift resettlement into promised new social housing units.
On 11 December, in orange vests, unemployed inhabitants of Roissat, Ziaiana and Sidi Khouled near Ouargla blocked the road and confiscated three fuel tankers to call for employment.
On 11 December, in orange vests, unemployed inhabitants of Roissat, Ziaiana and Sidi Khouled near Ouargla blocked the road and confiscated three fuel tankers to call for employment.
On 11 December, in orange vests, unemployed inhabitants of Roissat, Ziaiana and Sidi Khouled near Ouargla blocked the road and confiscated three fuel tankers to call for employment.
On 10 December, social housing applications from Sour el Ghozlane protested in front of the prefecture to denounce the fact that they could not find their names on published social housing lists.

column7: Labour Group (Algeria); RCD: Rally for Culture and Democracy Party; LADDH: Algerian League for the Defense of Human Rights; FM: Future Front Party; Students (Algeria)
column16: El Watan (Algeria); Maghreb Emergent; TSA Algerie
column17: On 11 December, dozens of thousands of workers from the Cevital company, students and party cadres from the RCD and the Future Front and activists of the LADDH from Bejaia, Tizi Ouzou, Algiers and the inlands organised a protest in Bejaia to denounce the freezing of private investment to the Cevital group. Some of the protesters, also supported by local football fans, even called for the fall of the regime. Several protesters were blocked by roadblocks of the gendarmerie.
On 12 December, inhabitants of Said Abid called for development of the village and the construction of housing units.
On 12 December, social housing applicants protested in Oued Tlelat because they could not find their names on social housing beneficiaries lists even though they had applied in 2009 and 2012.

On 13 December, inhabitants protested in front of the prefecture in Ain el Turck, Oran province, to denounce the standstill in negotiations between different segments of the prefecture, which are in clinch for more than 10 months, affecting public works in the city.
In the week of 12 December, farmers protested in front of the governor's seat in Bechar to call for the abolition of a 15-year old directive which prohibits to use border land as range land.

On 12 December, students from the fine arts university in Azazga have protested for more than a week to denounce the critical situation in the school and counterproductive actions, strikes and protests organised by the UGTA syndicate against the school. 3 protests coded on 5, 8 and 12 December.

Whereas the protests by students from faculty of economics, business and management at the Mouloud Mammeri campus in Tamda stopped, students from the human and social sciences faculty continue to protest and paralyse all administrative activities at the universtiy. Two protests coded on 8 December and 12 December.

On 12 December, over a thousand workers from the steel complex in Sider el Hadjar, Annaba, blocked the factory through preventing the transportation of cast iron to call for permanent contracts for the third day in a row. They remained on strike as of December 13. Coded as two events on December 9th and 12th.

On 12 December, public officials working in the social sector in the prefecture in Sidi Bel Abbes staged a sit-in to call for the resignation of the secretary general, deeming him unfit to take care of social affairs.

column7: Teachers (Algeria); SNCCOPEN: National Union of Common Bodies and Professional Workers in Public Education
column17: On 12 December, on the second day of their general strike, teaching personnel from the SNCCOPEN syndicate protested in Biskra to call for an improvement of their socio-professional situation, including higher salaries.

column7: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers; Health Workers (Algeria)
column17: On 12 December, paramedical workers from the UGTA staged a sit-in in front of the syndicates seat in Algiers to call for the resignation of the secretary general Sidi Said.
On 13 December, teachers from the University Constantine 3 staged a sit-in in the university city Ali Mendjeli to call for the provision of natural gas to their housing units in the university city.

On 13 December, inhabitants of the Es Senia suburb blocked the road through physically protesting before gendarmerie peacefully dispersed the protest. The protesters want to shed light on the dire situation in the suburb, especially on the problem that the nearby river overflows in winter.

On 13 December, a party member of a government delegation was shouted at by young protesters during her visit in Naciria. The protesters were angry with her statements regarding the Berber language although she said that she is only against teaching Amazigh in the Latin alphabet, not against teaching it in general.

On 13 December, a party member of a government delegation was shouted at by young protesters during her visit in Chaabet el-Ameur. The protesters were angry with her statements regarding the Berber language although she said that she is only against teaching Amazigh in the Latin alphabet, not against teaching it in general.

On 13 December, inhabitants of Ait Ibrahim, Mchedallah district, blocked the main road in the city with burning tires and tree trunks to call for de-mining in the city by the military after a bomb has been found the day before in Ath Yebrahim in Mchedallah district.
On 13 December, pupils from Ahmed Ben Bella school in the outskirts of Sidi Bel Abbes protested in front of their school to call for heating classes and improving hygiene.

On 13 December, heavy clashes broke out between inhabitants of Si Mustapha who support the president of the prefecture who had his candidacy for senate elections denied and the Gendarmerie. The gendarmerie injured several rioters.

On 14 December, rioters clashed with knifes and swords at the public transport station in the center of Ain Mlila. The brawl initially broke out because students on a motorcycle were driving too fast through the taxi station. Dozens of young people then joined fights on both sides and 14 people were injured.
On 14 December, a man who broke through a gendarmerie checkpoint in al Oued and who was later found by gendarmerie in a building in the city was shot dead because he refused efforts to arrest him.
Around December 14, different educational institutions in Bouira organised different protests. Among them the Karim Belkacem school and the Siddiq Ben Yahya foundation.
On 14 December, social housing applicants shut down the prefecture in Msila to call for a swift publication of social housing beneficiaries lists.
On 15 Dec 2018, those excluded from the list of beneficiaries of public rental housing units (social housing) demonstrated in Annaba, barricading several roads with trees and burning tyres.
On 16 December, 2018, temporary workers continued their protest in Annaba, which has entered a second week, demanding that their jobs be secured.
On 16 December, 2018, residents of Aokas took to the streets in anger to protest against local authorities's repetitive false promises of natural gas provisions.

On 16 Dec 2018, four homemade bombs, chemical substances to manufacture explosives as well as three terrorist bunkers were destroyed in a search-and-combing operation in Batna by the National People's Army.

16-17 Dec 2018, around a hundred master's degree students in microbial ecology at the Faculty of Natural and Life Sciences staged a sit-in in front of Universite Constantine 1 (Mentouri) in Constantine city due to the restructuring of their degree.

column7: Labour Group (Algeria); SNCP: National Union of Permanent Researchers
column17: On 17 Dec 2018, the National Union of Permanent Researchers (SNCP) staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research, Alger in order to pressure the administration to act upon their socio-professional demands.
On 18 December, 2018, Algerian military forces discovered a cache of weapons and ammunition in Bordj Badji Mukhtar containing 10 ground missiles, 6 mortars and valves and other stores of ammunition.
On 18 December, 2018, two families clashed over a dispute of land distribution in Djelfa resulting in the injuries of 10 people.
On 18 December, 2018, Algerian military forces found two workshops creating weapons in Tipaza and Mascara and seized firearms, rifles, grenades in addition to ammunition.
On 18 December, 2018, Algerian military forces found two workshops creating weapons in Tipaza and Mascara and seized firearms, rifles, grenades in addition to ammunition.

On 18 Dec 2018, dozens of subscribers of the programme AADL 2 staged a protest rally in Oran at the seat of the wilaya (governorate) demanding intervention of the executive chief. Their records were accepted by the Housing Improvement and Development Agency in 2013 but they were unable to pay the first installment and were hence excluded from the programme.

On 19 Dec 2018, about twenty academics, mostly from the University Mohamed-Boudiaf, staged a sit in at the wilaya (governorate) seat in Oran denouncing that they had been waiting for housing for years.

column7: Labour Group (Algeria); SNAPAP: National Independent Union of Public Administration Personnel
column17: On 19 Dec 2018, Snapap trade unionists staged a sit-in in front of the Social Action Directorate (DAS) in Constantine in order to discuss workers' concerns.

On 19 December, 2018, residents of the district of 17 October 61 Al Ateeq cut the national road No. 20 between the states of Guelma and Constantine to appeal to authorities demanding an end to their 19-year suffering.
On 19 Dec 2018, young contract workers (CTA and CDD) launched a general blockade at the steel company Sider El Hadjar in El Hadjar town following ten days of striking.

On 20 Dec 2018, those excluded from the list of beneficiaries of public rental housing units (social housing) of Annaba staged a sit-in followed by a march in front of the wilaya (governorate). The march was dispersed by the police.

On 22 Dec 2018, students of the Chemistry department of Akli Mohand Oulhadj university in Bouira continued to block access to the university pole for all faculty and students, demanding better teaching conditions and denouncing shortcomings of the administration. The protest has been going on for over a month.
On 23 Dec 2018, a militant possessing a weapon surrendered to the military authorities in Tamanrasset.
On 23 December, 2018, residents of Bou Hamara closed the entrance to Annanba protesting a policy of exclusion in the distribution of social housing in Annaba.
On 25 Dec 2018, youth demonstrators blocked entrance and exit roads of Annaba town and burned tires in protest against the lists of housing beneficiaries issued by the authorities.

On 25 Dec 2018, protesters gathered in front of the wali's cabinet in Constantine and other part of the city to demonstrate against social housing decisions. The protesters included beneficiaries of pre-allocation decisions of social housing whose names did not appeared on the lists posted, as well as applicants who were not listed as beneficiaries.

On 26 Dec 2018, the inhabitants of Ain S'Khoun village in Bejaia municipality staged a rally at the APC headquarters in Bejaia. They demanded improvements of the village infrastructure and living conditions as they had been promised by elected officials.

On 27 December, 2018, dozens of residents of the town of Teqirsift in Freha close the municipality headquarters in protest against a recent decision by local authorities to convert 30 hectares of farm land to industrial land.

On 27 Dec 2018, the authorities prevented a protest of dismissed Sonelgaz workers at the central post office in Algiers and arrested several trade union officials belonging to the Confederation of Power Produces Syndicate, as well as dozens of trade unionists.

On 29 Dec 2018, residents of Gdyel commune set up barricades on the main axis (avenue Hammou Boutlelis) in protest against the passage of heavy trucks serving a local quarry. As per the protesters, heavy trucks were prone to accidents, which exposed local residents to danger.

On 30 December, 2018, residents of Bidari closed the road between Sidi Ashour and Al-Boni University with burning tires and piles of rocks because of grievances regarding social housing and marginalization.

On 30 Dec 2018, hundreds of protesters staged a rally at the local AADL headquarters in Jija, presenting their grievances related to the 2001-2002 AADL housing programme. The protesters complained that the allocation of a significant number of housing had gone to people not listed as programme subscribers in 2001-2002, creating panic and mistrust in the system.
On 30 Dec 2018, residents and traders protested at Vasas square in Ain El Turk town against heavy road traffic and chaos that typically affects surrounding areas.
On 31 December, 2018 military forces detonated an improvised bomb in Batna. The explosive device was placed in a battery charger in a parking garage by unknown suspects.
On 2 Jan 2019, the National People's Army shot dead two militant fighters in Sidi Bel-Abbes wilaya. The victims had been wanted for terrorism. The army seized their weapons and ammunition.
Weapons seizure: On 2 Jan 2019, the army seized a Kalashnikov-type machine gun, five ammunition cartouches, 400 bullets, 30 generators, 22 jackhammers and various detonation tools in Tamanrasset
During the week of 02 January, 2019, civilians held a protest in Tipaza after the release of the list of beneficiaries of social housing.
On 03 January, 2019, youth in Sidi Salem closed a road and burned rubber tires condemning their marginalization, poverty and unemployment.
On 03 January, 2019, over 500 taxi drivers gathered in Oran to protest the sudden increase of price of transportation fare to the Isto station.

On 4 Jan 2019, about twenty applicants for social housing gathered at the APC headquarters in Zerizer commune of Besbes daira in El Tarf wilaya demonstrating against the reportedly unfair and inconsistent distribution of social housing. The protesters also demanded the investigation of the applicants' files for this type of housing.
On 01 May, 2019, demonstrators gathered in Bejaia to protest against the regime [size=300].

On 05 January, 2019, residents of Illizi, furious about the final results of the National Assembly elections, blocked the road in front of the state headquarters, burning tires and throwing stones, as well as breaking a statue in the middle of the city. Demonstrators broke out into skirmishes and clashes with police officers and security detail.

On 6 Jan 2019, dozens of parents blocked the road leading to Benaddellah district near Ahmed Cheddani primary school (3 km from downtown Bouira), denouncing the lack of consistency and lack of quality of education provided by the school.

On 6 Jan 2019, protesters gathered at the wilaya seat in Tebessa, demonstrating against the allocation of public rental units. The protesters comprised mostly of those whose names were not included on lists of housing beneficiaries.
On 06 January, 2019, residents of Bouandas, Setif helf a protest closing several roads, demanding a hospital in their town after a pregnant woman's death due to lack of medical care.

On 6 Jan 2019, about fifty employees of the national company of hydraulic works (GTH) staged a sit-in at the wilaya headquarters in Constantine denouncing unfair dismissal of workers, claiming payment of overdue wages and demanding better employment conditions.
On 7 Jan 2019, dozens of social housing beneficiaries protested at the wilaya headquarters in Dirah (south of Bouira), claiming allocation of properties they had been promised.

On 7 Jan 2019, a hundred young applicants for social housing protested at the daira headquarters in Boumerdes demanding realocation of social housing and distribution of housing that had been promised.
On 07 January, 2019, residents of Skikda held a demonstration in front of the Wilaya headquarters where they denounced the complacency and indifference of LPA projects at the state capital.

On 7 Jan 2019, dozens of traders gathered at the wilaya headquarters in Boumerdes to protest against the daira head's decision to close the weekly market. The market had been closed the previous week due to low revenues.
On 7 Jan 2019, residents of Sidi Ayad commune in Sidi Aich daira shut down RN26 road connecting Bejaia to Algiers in protest, claiming housing they had been promised by the authorities.

On 7 Jan 2019, social housing (AADL2) subscribers staged a rally in front of AADL headquarters in El Mansourah, Constantine to express concerns about distribution of social housing. According to protesters, the demonstration was attended by 16 000 people.
On 8 Jan 2019, about a hundred protesters staged a sit-in outside the wilaya headquarters in Skikda, expressing their discontent with LPA housing allocations.

On 8 Jan 2019, the buyers of 300 LSP housing units in Ighil Anane of Boghni commune staged a sit-in at the wilaya headquarters of Tizi Ouzou. The protesters demanded the completion of construction work of these dwellings.

On 9 Jan 2019, slum dwellers in Beni Azza locality on the outskirts of Blida blocked rail traffic between Algiers and El Affroun in protest against their living conditions. The blockade was intended to put pressure on authorities to transfer them into decent housing. Fires were lit in the area.

On 13 Jan 2019, subscribers to the AADL social housing programme demonstrated at the AADL branch office in Bermadia near Relizane, demanding the allocation of housing for which they had reportedly been shortlisted.
On 13 Jan 2019, residents of Skikda's old buildings gathered at Church Square in Skikda to draw the attention of the authorities to the inadequate housing situation of the residents.
On 13 January, 2019 scores of civilians gathered in Assi Bou Nif cutting the national road n.4 to protest the unreliability of water, gas and electicity supply to the commune.
On 14 Jan 2019, market traders held a sit-in at the wilaya headquarters in Boumerdes, following the decision of the authorities to close a local market every Monday.
On 14 Jan 2019, social housing seekers, mostly women, staged a sit-in in front of the wali's office to demand allocation of housing during next distribution.
On 14 January, 2019, Algerian military forces found and destroyed two terrorist hideouts in Chlef and Boumerdes.
On 14 January, 2019, Algerian military forces found and destroyed two terrorist hideouts in Chlef and Boumerdes.
On 14 January, 2019, unemployed youth held a protest in Laghouat where they cut their bodies with knives and razor blades denouncing ""irregularities"" and corruption in employment offers.

On 15 Jan 2019, employees of Dauphin d'Or company located in Bechloul staged a protest at the wilaya headquarters in Bouira, demanding the reopening of the factory that had been closed for over three months.
During the month of January, a demonstration took place in the Laayoune refugee camp near Tindouf over electricity shortages.
On 15 Jan 2019, families blocked Boulevard Maata as well as tramway tracks in Oran in order to draw attention to their grievances related to housing and demands for relocation.

On 16 Jan 2019, citizens seeking social housing demonstrated in Constantine, storming the seat of the wilaya. The demonstrators mostly included those who did not find themselves on the 2nd list of social housing recipients, posted on the same morning.
On 16 January, 2019, members of an unidentified militant group shot and killed one citizen while injuring another in Tarik Ibn Ziad city.
On or around 16 January, 2019, students gathered in schools in Chlef protesting against the bad conditions of their institutions such as lack of heating.

On 16 Jan 2019, teachers from University of 20-August-1955 University in Skikda, who applied for university residences, staged a sit-in in front of the rectorate demanding the resumption of work on dilapidated housing.

On 18 Jan 2019, residents of Tighermine in El-Esnam municipality blocked national road no. 33 between Bouira and Tikjda climate station, demanding the resumption of a project expected to connect their village to natural gas. The project had been paused due to local opposition.
On 19 January, 2019, Algerian military forces seized a cache of weapons and over 100 rounds of ammunition of various caliber in Jijel.
On 21 January, 2019, Sahrawis in Camp Rabouni protested the death of Omar Ould Anay demanding justice for the suspected Polisario.
On 22 January, 2019, teachers and administrators in the Annaba region participated in sit ins related to the ongoing strikes against the ministry of education and formation.
On 22 January, 2019, teachers and administrators in the Constantine region participated in sit ins related to the ongoing strikes against the ministry of education and formation.
On 22 January 2019, teachers and administrators in the Setif region participated in sit ins related to the ongoing strikes against the ministry of education and formation.

On 24 January, 2019, rioters in the town of Magra (M'sila province) closed national road 28, setting up barricades and lighting rubber tires on fire in protest of the lack of attention on the part of authorities.

column7: CNMR: National Coordination of Retired Military Personnel
column17: On 27 January, 2019, members of the National Coordination of military Retirees/Pensionaries tried to regroup in Algiers to protest against their social condition. Army forces dispersed them.
On 28 January, 2019, Algerian civilians in the town of Tizi Ouzou protested lack of support on the part of authorities.
On 29 January, 2019, 2 military personnel were injured in the explosion of a bomb while raking the area in Oued Taourira.

On 30 January, 2019, workers attached to the Ministry of Culture organized a protest in front of the Oran Zeddour-Brahim Palace of Culture demanding to be more involved in the decision making processes regarding the Palace of Culture.

column7: CNMR: National Coordination of Retired Military Personnel
column17: On 30 January, 2019, members of the National Coordination of military Retirees/Pensionaries participated in a sit-in in front of the ANP building in Algiers, Alger, to denounce the President of the assembly, Mouadh Bouchareb's description of them as being """"ungrateful."""" Army forces intervened injuring several people.
On 30 January, 2019, protestors in the city of El M'Ghair clashed with police forces. The clashes involved tear gas, molotov cocktails and throwing stones.
On 31 January, 2019, Sahrawi families participated in organized protests in Tindouf against malnutrition and lack of humanitarian aid in the area.
On 31 January, 2019, protestors styled in yellow vests patterned after the series of protests throughout France took to the streets to protest restrictions in freedom of movement in the terriroires.
On 31 January, 2019, Algerian naval forces shot and killed a Tunisian sailor on a fishing boat after the boat entered the Algerian territorial waters.
On 31 January, 2019, some 300 residents of al-Najah cut the Raghaya National road no.5 denouncing the lack of social housing.

On 01 February, 2019, Sahrawis protested several kidnappings involving Polisario members in Rabouni, Tindouf. Chants included: ""Where are human rights?"" and ""No alternative to determining the fate of Ahmed El Khalil.""
On 02 February, 2019, dozens of retirees and wounded former soldiers were arrested in a protest outside the capitol in Algiers.
On and around 03 February, 2019, protesters gathered in Maghnia calling for the cancellation of social housing and its committee.
On 03 February, 2019, residents of Taoura blocked a road protesting the murder of a 16 year old killed at a high school.
On 03 February, 2019, parents of students from Sidi Mechhour attending school in Hammam Boughrara took to the streets to protest the lack of public transportation to and from the two locations.
On 03 February, 2019, dozens of citizens blocked a road in Tiaret to protest against discrimination in the government processes of alotting aid for social housing, local commerce, etc.
On 03 February, 2019, Algerian military forces seized an arsenal of weapons in Tamanrasset.
On 04 February, 2019, scores of unionists protested in front of the Ministry of Labor demanding the reinstatement of 11 workers from the Sonelgaz group. Four protesters were arrested.
On 05 February, 2019, workers gathered in Bejaia protesting their late pay.
On 05 February, 2019, workers gathered in front of the APC building in Tamanrasset protesting their late pay.
On 05, February, 2019, dozens of protesters closed the headquarters of the M'sila municipality to protest the lack of gas in cold times.
On 05 February, 2019, more than 60 staged a rally in front of the headquarters of the Oran wilaya protesting their late pay.
On 06 February, 2019, students in Tizi Ouzou marched towards the seat of the wilaya in protest against the Ministry of Education and Scientific Research.
On 07 February, 2019, a group of citizens in Taghzout staged a protest against the ever-increasing rates of transportation between Taghzout and Bouira.
On 07 February, 2019, a group of students at the Annaba University staged a rally in protest of the murder of a Zimbabwean student.
On 08 February, 2019, detachments of the National People's Army (ANP) found and defused two homemade bombs in Boumerdes and Meda.
On 08 February, 2019, detachments of the National People's Army (ANP) found and defused two homemade bombs in Boumerdes and Meda.

On 09 February, 2019, members of the CLB (Literary Cafe of Bejaia) club held a sit-in in front of the headquarters of the main Bejaia library to protest restrictions in the group's freedom of assembly.
On 13 February, 2019, Students at a professional school organized a protest in Tizi Ouzou ""denouncing bad working conditions"".
On 14 February, 2019, workers at El Fadj newspaper held a sit-in in frot of the newspaper headquarters in Tahar Djaout, Algiers, to protest the delay in receiving their paychecks.

column7: Students (Algeria); Lawyers (Algeria); Labour Group (Algeria); Government of Algeria (1999-)
column17: On 15 February, 2019, a group of students, unionists, lawyers, El Adala-elected officials and citizens held a demonstration in protest of Bouteflika's bid for a fifth term as president at the regional Azzedine Medjoubi theater in Algiers.
On 15 February, 2019 civilians in Bouira barricaded the RN30 road with burning tires near Tikjda protesting the attitude of public powers.

On 16 February, 2019, protestors gathered in Kherrata denouncing the regime and Bouteflika's bid for a 5th mandate as persident shouting slogans such as ""pouvoir assassin"" (power is the assassin) and ""the people demand the demise of the regime.""
On 16 February, 2019, six protesters were arrested in Ain Beida in the state of Oum El Bouaghi during a demonstration opposing the current president, Boutelika and his first minister, Ahmed Ouyahia.

On 17, February, 2019, protesters closed two national roads. The reason for their protest is unknown, though it is thought to be related to ""social issues"" such as gas supply, roads status, social housing, etc.
On 19 February, 2019, National forces seized a chache of weapons in Temanarasset.
On 18 February, 2019, a group of discharged former members of the army serving between 1992 an 1996 held a sit-in in Tizi Ouzou demanding their rights as former members of the group.
On 18 February, 2019, a homemade bomb was destroyed in Tizi Ouzou.
On 19 February, 2019, protesters closed a national road leading from Constantine to Skikda in Collo as a way to bring attention to their demands for social housing.
On 19 February, 2019, protesters (mostly women) gathered in Constantine to protest against their ""unjust exclusion"" from being allotted social housing.
On 23 February, 2019, Algerian security forces arrested 40 people in demonstrations against Bouteflika's 5h mandate.
On 19, February, 2019, thousands of citizens protested in Khenchala against the pro-5th Mandate mayor of the city who proposed to close the city to any opposing candidates.

On 21 February, 2019, thousands of Algerians took to the streets in Annaba to welcome the new presidential candidate, Rachid Nekkaz, shouting hostile slogans against president Bouteflika'a 5th mandate.
On 21 February, 2019, protesters gathered in Tichy to protest against president Bouteflika'a 5th mandate.

On 21 February, 2019, tens of thousands of Algerians took to the streets in Constantine to welcome the new presidential candidate, Rachid Nekkaz, shouting hostile slogans against president Bouteflika'a 5th mandate.
On 22 February, 2019, tens of thousands of civilians across over 40 wilayas (states) in Algeria took to the streets in protest against president Bouteflika'a 5th mandate.
On 22 February, 2019 many protesters gathered in the streets of Algiers to oppose Bouteflik'as 5th mandate.
On 22 February, 2019, tens of thousands of civilians across over 40 wilayas (states) in Algeria took to the streets in protest against president Bouteflika'a 5th mandate.
